link:labelLink.link:label: Amount of collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of liabilities for materials and services evidenced by vouchers which have been pre-audited and signed by the proper authority approving the liability. Debit upon payment of vouchers; credit for amounts approved for payment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Services provided by persons or businesses to assist in transmitting and receiving messages or information. This category includes telephone and voice communication services; data communication services to establish or maintain computer‐based communications, networking and Internet services; video communications services to establish or maintain one‐way or two‐way video communications via satellite, cable or other devices; postal communications services to establish or maintain postage machine rentals, postage, express delivery services and couriers. Include licenses and fees for services such as subscriptions to research materials over the Internet.
Expenditures for communications, for example, telephone, cellphone, radios, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of redeemable bonds payable during the current fiscal year. Also called demand bonds.

Expenditures for all other public safety services, not including fire, corrections, jail, emergency 911, building inspection and regulation and police, sheriff, constable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for energy, including gas, oil, coal, gasoline, and services received from public and private utility companies. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from services performed, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.

Expenditures for economic development services used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as appropriations to the local chamber of commerce, junior chamber of commerce, or other similar organizations promoting the economic development of a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for transportation, meals, lodging, and other expenses associated with travel for the school district. Payments for per diem in lieu of reimbursements for subsistence (room and board) are also charged here. Travel costs associated with field trips are coded here except transportation costs.

Services to the school district which are not regarded as professional but require basic scientific knowledge, manual skills, or both Included are data processing services, purchasing and warehousing services, graphic arts, etc.
Actual Rate of Return on Pension Assets, period five year period.
Information about Funds Balances Nonspendable.
Information about expenditures for economic development.
Amount of cost of acquisition or constructions of streets and highways.
The aggregate amount of revenues and expenses resulting from nonoperating activities (for example, interest and dividend revenue, property, plant and equipment impairment loss, and so forth).
Other financing obligations, noncurrent.
Purchased property services which are not classified elsewhere.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from services performed.
Revenues from taxes and tax-related amounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of cost of acquisition or constructions of parks and recreation equipment.
Cost incurred for lottery retail bonuses.

Enter the system's liabilities (actuarial accrued liabilities) as calculated using uniform assumptions reported at the valuation period ending date from the most recent actuarial valuation report for funding.

Expenditures for Register of Deeds used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., necessary to operate this office. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for health and welfare, emergency services and ambulance used in the General Fund or Special Revenue Ambulance Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries, travel, training supplies, etc., that are necessary for operating the ambulance service. It may also be used in reporting revenues raised by the ambulance service. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts owed by a local unit to the State that are due in more than one year Detailed sub-accounts should be maintained if more than one advance is received. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Interfund accounts receivable, net of allowance.
Expenditures for the original purchase of land, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for parks and recreation.
Interfund accounts receivable.
The number of inactive members who have accumulated benefits but not retired, and are not yet receiving those benefits.

Expenditures for Recreation and Culture, parks and recreation used on the General Fund or a Parks/Recreation Fund. It will reflect all expenditures of a park or recreation program including administration, park facilities, supervision, policing, lighting and maintenance of facilities, and any other parks or recreation activities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Represents drain orders payable for years subsequent to the current fiscal year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount estimated obligation for costs related to landfill post-closure care that are due and payable in future periods.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local government unit for services performed but not yet billed, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.

Expenditures for Library services, used on the General Fund, where it may reflect all library expenditures. Can also be used in a Library Fund, where it will reflect such expenditures as salaries and wages of library personnel, travel expenditures, library supplies, bookmobile expenditures, branch library expenditures, the purchase of books and audiovisuals, and all other expenditures necessary to provide library services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Actual Rate of Return on Pension Assets, period Ten year period.

Expenditures for other development services not including redevelopment and public housing, planning and zoning, and economic development. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from Treasurer.
Expenditures for public ways and facilities services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expense for books, textbooks, and periodicals prescribed and available for general use, including library and reference books. This category includes the cost of workbooks, textbook binding or repairs, as well as textbooks which are purchased to be resold or rented. Also recorded here are costs of binding or other repairs to school library books.
Amount of assessments that are paid in advance of the charge.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local government unit for services performed but not yet billed.
Allowance for tenant accounts receivable.

Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Funded ratio for uniform assumptions is based on the ratio of assets (actuarial value of plan assets) to actuarially accrued liabilities on a plan-year basis as reported using uniform assumptions.
Cost of operations items that are not regularly recurring, and noncapital, that benefit future periods.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for prepaids.
Information about expenditures for debt service.
Allowance for receivables.
Information about the fund balances.
Revenues earned from services rendered to other units or other departments. Used in the General Fund of a local unit of government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for patient accounts receivable.

Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.

Revenues earned from friend of the court, used on the General Fund or Friend of the Court Fund or both funds of a county. Its use is mandatory. Reflects revenue such as support fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of the excess of net position in a pension plan system to the total pension liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Specific costs of service that a regulatory agency permits a U.S. public utility (usually an energy company) to recover in future rates.
The number of retirees and beneficiaries receiving benefits. This does not include terminated employees who have accumulated benefits, but not retired, and are not yet receiving those benefits.
Allowance for customer and other government receivable.
Revenue earned from delinquent real property tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other supplies.

Carrying amount, net of allowances for uncollectible amounts, as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet.
Information about investment income and rentals.
Allowance for insurance settlements receivable.

Debt service, interest and other charges which covers debt service payments other than principal repayment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for tangible property other than buildings and improvements, for example machinery, tools, trucks and furnishings, including costs incurred in the acquisition of machinery and equipment.
Revenue from tax reverted property. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Enter the system's actuarially determined contribution (ADC) as calculated using uniform assumptions.
State grants for crime victims' rights. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Extraordinary items. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for medicaid (UPL) receivable.
The portion of interest receivable on special assessments estimated not to be collectible.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet.

Ratio of ADC (as calculated using uniform assumptions) to governmental fund revenues (as reported from the most recent audited financial statements). If a local government has multiple plans, all ADC amounts are added together to calculate the ratio to governmental fund revenues.
Current portion of land contracts due to the local unit, net of uncollectible amounts.
State grants for special election reimbursement. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from other general activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of interest and penalties receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Amounts set aside for specific use by donors.
Restricted for state preschool program reserve.
Investment in capital assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Income (loss) before capital contributions and transfers.

Accounts payable is a liability account reflecting amounts owed to private persons or organizations for goods and services received by a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Restricted for risk related, restricted capital reserve.
The portion of tax liens receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Accelerated payments advanced to the local government from the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CVS) where such amounts are due in years subsequent to the current fiscal year.
Amounts due to other funds within the same reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Ratio of all pension systems combined ADC to governmental fund revenues. If a local government has multiple plans, all ADC amounts are added together to calculate the ratio to governmental fund revenues.

Revenue earned from business licenses and permits and franchise fees. License and permit fees exacted (either for revenue raising or for regulation) as a condition to the exercise of a business privilege. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from sales. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of contributions classified as other. Contributions to term and permanent endowments, contributions to permanent fund principal, special and extraordinary items between governmental and business-type activities should each be reported separately from, but in the same manner as, general revenues.
Current portion of land contracts due to the local unit.

Revenues earned from sanitation services, for example sewerage charges, street sanitation, and refuse collection charges. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of special assessments liens receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements.

Represent lease contracts receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, within one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Restricted for BEST Capital Renewal Reserve.
Revenue earned from writ of garnishment, restitution, attachment or execution. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues earned from animal shelter and dog warden activities is on the General Fund Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of sales tax receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for general government purposes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for health and welfare, state institutions, may be used in any other fund in which payments are made for care provided by state institutions. It reflects payments by the county to the State of Michigan for care of county residents at various state institutions. Payments are made on the basis of monthly billings to the counties. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about total and all other state grants and contributions.

Services which by their nature can be performed only by persons or firms with specialized skills and knowledge. While a product may or may not result from the transaction, the primary reason for the purchase is the service provided Included are the services of architects, engineers, auditors, dentists, medical doctors, lawyers, consultants, teachers, accountants, brokers, etc.
Restricted for total program reserve.

Amounts paid on behalf of employees; generally, these amounts are not included in the gross salary, but are in addition to that amount. Such payments are fringe benefit payments and, while not paid directly to employees, are part of the cost of personal services. Workers’ compensation premiums should not be charged here.

Amount of receivables for short-term leases. GASB 87 indicates that a short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement of the lease term, has a maximum possible term under the lease contract of 12 months (or less), including any options to extend, regardless of the probability of being exercised. For a lease that is cancelable by either the lessee or the lessor, such as a rolling month-to-month lease or a year-to-year lease, the maximum possible term is the noncancelable period, including any notice periods. The lessee should recognize lease receivable if payments are made in advance. The lessor should recognize lease receivable for rent due if payments are to be received subsequent to the reporting period.
The portion of income tax receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements.
Amounts, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements.
Information about intergovernmental revenue from state government.

The amount of monies on deposit in savings accounts under the control of the official or agent designated as custodian. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions to State University Retirement System (SURS) that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Capital grants.
Allowance for the portion of delinquent taxes estimated to be uncollectible.
Information about expenses on the Statement of Operations.

Used in the General Fund or a corresponding Enterprise Fund or Internal Service Fund. Its use is mandatory in the Internal Service Fund and Enterprise Fund. Its use is optional in the General Fund. It may be used to reflect both expenses and revenues in the operation of the information technology department. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of delinquent special assessments receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Amounts that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements.
Revenue from grants and entitlement programs not restricted for specific programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other current liabilities payable from restricted assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
State grants for state revenue sharing purposes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about contributions from local units.

Services purchased to operate, repair, maintain, and rent property owned or used by the government. These services are performed by persons other than government employees. While a product may or may not result from the transaction, the primary reason for the purchase is the service provided.
Amounts due from counties. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenues from recreation and culture activities, used on the General Fund or Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects revenues earned in park facilities, recreation programs, and cultural programs within a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for roads, streets and bridges, used on the General Fund. It reflects all expenditures pertaining to the construction or maintenance of roads, streets or bridges not included under 1951 PA 51. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of rent receivable estimated not to be collectible.

Current amount due to the local government unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received. The amounts recorded in this amount also represent net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.

Expenditures for training, used on the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of governments. It reflects such expenditures as the salary of the training officer, police academy expenditures, attendance at training seminars, and other supplies, and expenditures essential to the training program for police officers.
Noncurrent liabilities, due within one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Purchased services other than those described above. Any interdistrict payments other than tuition and transportation should be classified here.

Current amount due to the local government unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received.
Inventory of goods held for resale.
Information about expenses for judicial activities.

Cost of materials and parts on hand which are used for the repair, maintenance, and operation of equipment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cumulative total balance of all patient charges due, owed and outstanding. Amount reported net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
Contributions from local government units for general government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for rubbish collection and disposal, used on the General Fund, or in a separate Rubbish Collection Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, maintenance costs, equipment, and all other expenses necessary to render this service. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts for medical billings receivable.
Allowance for loans and notes receivable.
Information about expenditures for general government.
Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions.
Information about programs that are funded through federal, state and local grants. Use line items with Type of Program Revenues Axis to identify the appropriate type and source of funding.
Carrying amount, net of allowances for uncollectible amounts, as of the balance sheet date of amounts due of insurance settlements.
Allowance for uncollectible amounts of special assessments classified as noncurrent due to the government entity, derived from state, municipal or school districts.
Amounts for emergency medical services receivable.
Amount of taxes levied and related charges which have become due but have not been collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A financial interest in a joint venture evidenced by the ownership of shares of the joint venture’s stock or by otherwise having an explicit, measurable right to the net resources of the joint venture that is usually based on an investment of financial or capital resources by a participating government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about programs that are funded through federal grants. Use line items with Type of Program Revenues Axis to identify the appropriate type and source of funding.

Amount for lease assets for leases other than short-term leases and contracts that transfer ownership defined by GASB 87. At the commencement of the lease term, a lessee should recognize a lease liability and an intangible right-to-use lease asset a lessee initially should measure the lease asset as the sum of the following: 1) the amount of the initial measurement of the lease liability; 2) lease payments made to the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term, less any lease lease incentives received from the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term; 3) initial direct costs that are ancillary charges necessary to place the lease asset into service. Reported net of accumulated amortization.

Expenditures for Abstract Department, used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., necessary to operate the abstract office. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about restricted assets, classified as noncurrent.

Expenditures for trial court, used in the General Fund and may be found in any unit of government that acts as the local funding unit for a demonstration project (consolidated) trial court. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about all other services rendered charges.
Cost incurred for lottery operator fees.

Amounts paid to employees in either temporary or permanent positions for work performed in addition to the normal work period for which the employee is compensated under regular salaries and temporary salaries. The terms of such payment are subject to federal, state, and local regulations and interpretation. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cumulative total balance of medicaid (UPL) charges due, owed and outstanding. Amount reported net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
Revenue from Rents. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of buildings.

Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
Allowance for notes receivable.

Professional services other than educational that are supporting the operation. Included are medical doctors, lawyers, architects, auditors, accountants, therapists, audiologists, dietitians, editors, negotiations specialists, system analysts, planners, brokers, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenses for other public works.

Expenditures for parks supervision, used on the General Fund or on a Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, and equipment necessary to supervise park operation or recreation programs of a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for redevelopment and public housing.
Information about accrued liabilities, noncurrent.
Investments held at amortized cost.
Information about sites.
Current amount due to the local unit on Interfund loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts.
Current investments designated by the board.
Expenditures for rentals for example land and buildings or equipment and vehicles. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Replacement Tax, also known as Personal Property Replacement Tax, is a tax imposed on income of corporations, subchapter S corporations, partnerships, and trusts to replace money lost by local governments that can no longer impose personal property taxes.

Expenditures for health and welfare, redevelopment and housing used on the General Fund or in a Federal Project Fund. It reflects expenditures on redevelopment and housing projects which desire to include all costs of such projects under a single activity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Current amount due to the local unit on Interfund loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions.
Used to collect information on the statement of operations.
A consumption of OPEB related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.

Amount of wages earned by employees that are due and payable. Debit upon payment or by reversing the entry; credit for amounts of salaries and wages earned but not paid as of the end of an accounting period. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. This account is debited when the amount of penalties is accrued on taxes receivable each month; and credited when penalties are collected.
Contributions.
Information about special assessment revenues.

Transfer which are outflows of assets to a financing source. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable. This account is debited when the amount of penalties is accrued on taxes receivable each month; and credited when penalties are collected.
The interest payments on matured debt and loans that are due and payable within the normal operating cycle.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Middle/Junior High School Education.
Inventories, classified as current, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.

Expenses for activities concerned with providing community services to students, staff or other community participants. Examples of this program are the operation of a community swimming pool and a recreation program for the elderly, a child care center, etc.
Number of police personnel.
Amounts due and payable related to grants given out by the entity.
Bond premium, principal due within one year.

Grants, contributions and donations from others when the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue, fines and forfeitures and penalties are obtained through penalties and other law enforcement or court activities.
Cost of materials and parts on hand which are used for the repair, maintenance, and operation of equipment.
Bond premiums payable, amount due within one year.
Net (expense) revenue associated with substance abuse services.
Information about school district revenue.
Unamortized premium on general obligation bonds sold, principal due within one year.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Distributive/Marketing Education.
Revenue from an intermediate governmental unit in lieu of land. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in right to use asset.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Middle/Junior High School Education.
Information about investments.
Amounts due to townships.
Information about expenditures.

Positive or negative adjustments to state equalization funding due to state Department of Education audit findings or district repayment/return of unused carryover ASCENT slots. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in English Language Arts.
Information about school district revenue from local sources.
Expenses or assessments for membership in professional or other organizations. This includes any fee assessed for membership.

Operating activities generally result from providing services and producing and delivering goods, and include all transactions and other events that are not defined as capital and related financing, noncapital financing, or investing activities. Cash flows from operating activities generally are the cash effects of transactions and other events that enter into the determination of operating income.
Used to identify facts reported that represent all governmental funds.
Program revenues used for welfare programs.
Amount, excluding unamortized premium (discount) and debt issuance cost, of long-term debt due in more than one year. Excludes lease obligation.
Respond to the question, Do all investments comply with P.A. 20 of 1943. For a response of Yes, respond TRUE; response of No, respond FALSE.
Current portion of loans payable.
An unconditional transfer of cash or other assets to the local government unit.
Amount of matured bonds payable during the current fiscal year.
Information about school district revenue, intermediate sources.
Amounts reported for deferred inflows that are tied to grants. T
Expenditures for general government services, administration. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Used to identify types of governments.
Information about other information on the F65.

An Intergrant Transfer is when revenue is transferred from one grant to another, and those moneys are spent accordingly. Reported on a modified accrual basis. Example: transfer Title II Part A "Teacher Quality" grant revenue (grant 4367) over to Title I (grant 4010), and spend the transferred Teacher Quality money as Title I money. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses for activities concerned with establishing and administering policy for operating the school district. Do not include the Chief Business Official here, but in Support Services – Business (Program 2500).
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in English Language Arts.
Assets set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due to other public agencies and payable from restricted assets.
Used to identify facts reported that represent all governmental funds.
Revenue earned from federal leases which are distributed per state statute by the county commissioners.
Information about expenditures for other general government.
Respond to the question, Are there non-pension funds invested in derivatives at fiscal year-end? For a response of Yes, respond TRUE; response of No, respond FALSE.
Increase (decrease) in Net OPEB Asset.
Bond principal.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Middle/Junior High School Education.
Expenses for Instructional programs for adult students.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in English Language Arts.
Expenditures for public works and infrastructure. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Number of non-pension funds invested in derivatives at fiscal year-end.
Represents the General Fund, reported on the governmental funds statements.
Increase (decrease) in Net Pension Asset.
Cash and investments whose use in whole or in part is restricted for the long-term, generally by contractual agreements or regulatory requirements.
Amounts due from local unit employees for reimbursable goods or services provided to or on behalf of the employees.
This account is used to record the claims that the entity responsible for paying in future reporting periods.
Director fees.
Information about expenditures for sanitation.
Increase (decrease) in other assets. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Represents the aggregate nonmajor fund, reported on the governmental funds statements.
Amounts paid to other governments for local schools.

Expenses for the activities of architects and engineers related to acquiring and improving sites and improving buildings. Charges are made to this program only for those preliminary activities which may or may not result in additions to school district property. Otherwise, charge these services to 4100, 4200, 4500 or 4600, as appropriate.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Foreign Languages.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, tuition.
Expenses for trustee fees.
Expenditures for activities concerned with buying or constructing buildings. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Other amounts payable from restricted assets, which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Regulatory assets, classified as noncurrent.
Information about expenditures for health programs.
Increase (decrease) in deferred outflows, pension items.
Represents cash and cash equivalents, restricted. Restricted assets should be reported when restrictions on asset use change the nature or normal understanding of the availability of the asset.
Represents the total on the governmental funds statements.
Amounts due from villages.
Amounts paid to state for local schools.
An acquisition of pension related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time. May also include OPEB items.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, transportation.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Foreign Languages.
Revenue earned from tuition for programs other than summer school and inter-term programs Included here is tuition from individuals for preschool programs.
Expenditures for non instructional services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Management fees.
Increase (decrease) in deferred outflows, OPEB items.

Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against short-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
Amount of income tax revenue from non-residents.
Information about expenditures for welfare programs.
Amounts advanced to developers. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for public schools services.
Amount of bond proceeds receivable.
Information about patient services revenue.
Amounts due to the primary government within the same reporting entity.
Increase (decrease) in other deferred outflows.
Assets held by the local government unit that are not expected to be consumed within one year.
Information about expenditure for parks.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Foreign Languages.
Number of fire personnel.

Expenditures for activities concerned with paying, transporting, exchanging and maintaining goods and services for the school district. Included are the fiscal and internal services necessary for operating the school district. Include the Chief Business Official and the activities of the Chief Business Official here, unless reportable under 2501. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about the Statement of Activities.
Revenues used for indigent defense, such as assigned counsel, Public defender, and Contractual arrangements.

Revenue for activities concerned with establishing and administering policy for operating the school district. Do not include the Chief Business Official here, but in Support Services – Business (Program 2500).
Revenues from insurance payments received. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Unamortized gain (loss) on debt refunding.

Amount of the nonnegotiable (redemption terms that do not consider market rates) certificates of deposit(s) held by the local government unit treasurer or financial institution that will not be redeemed within the normal reporting cycle.
Increase (decrease) in deferred outflows.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, food services.
Capital and lateral fee revenues earned by the local government unit but not yet collected.
Information about expenditures for personal service, salaries and benefits.
Fees earned from individuals for transporting students to and from school.
Information about revenue designated for specific programs on the Statement of Activities.
Amount of vested employee benefits that's due and payable in future reporting periods.

Respond to the question, Does the unit have an investment policy approved by the governing body that complies with GASB statement No. 40. For a response of Yes, respond TRUE; response of No, respond FALSE.

Amount of advances to other entities where such advances are not due within a year. Debit for the amounts advanced by the local unit to another unit credit for the repayment of any portion of such advances.
Increase (decrease) in accounts payable.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Health Occupations Education.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Pre‐School Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue for activities concerned with providing community services to students, staff or other community participants. Examples of this program are the operation of a community swimming pool and a recreation program for the elderly, a child care center, etc.
Information about other expenditures for service or commodity, technical services.
Used to collect information about tables used on the Statement of Activities.
Repayments of amounts advanced to developers. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Full-time, part-time, and prorated portions of the costs for work performed by permanent employees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Respond to the question, Are there pension funds invested in derivatives at fiscal year-end? For a response of Yes, respond TRUE; response of No, respond FALSE.
Gross revenue earned from patient services.

Advances to other funds within the local government unit where such advances are not due within a year. Debit for amounts advanced to other funds; credit for the repayments of any portion of such advances.

Revenue for activities concerned with overall administrative responsibility for a school or a combination of schools, for example, Office of the Principal Services and other support services for school administration.
Increase (decrease) in net pension and OPEB liability.
Used as an identifier for Governmental activities or Business type activities. If Primary Governmental activities needs to be represented, do not use an axis.
Premium and discount on issuance of bonds.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from any source, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Amounts due from related parties including affiliates, employees, joint ventures, officers and stockholders, immediate families thereof, and pension funds within one year.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General High School Education.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Health Occupations Education.
Fees generated by providing transportation services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue for the activities of architects and engineers related to acquiring and improving sites and improving buildings. Charges are made to this program only for those preliminary activities which may or may not result in additions to school district property. Otherwise, charge these services to 4100, 4200, 4500 or 4600, as appropriate.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, community service activities.
Amounts paid to other governments for financial administration.
Revenues earned from students which are reimbursable under the provisions of the National School Lunch Program.
Revenue for cultural activities.
Increase (decrease) in accrued salaries and benefits.
Information about type of activities. Use for Governmental or Business activities. If Primary Government activities need to be represented, do not use an axis.

The excess of net position in a pension system to the total pension liability. It should be measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected payments that is attributable to past periods of employee service, net of the pension plan’s fiduciary net position.
Name of other nonoperating revenue expense which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Information about other expenditures for purchased property services.

Other restricted asset which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Amounts paid to state for financial administration.

Services in support of the various policy-making and managerial activities. Included are management consulting activities oriented to general governance or business and financial management; management support activities; and, election and tax collecting services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in accrued liabilities.

Primary government activities. A primary government is any state government or general purpose local government (municipality, village, township or county) as well as a special-purpose government (for example, a school district or a park district).

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from any source. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Health Occupations Education.
Revenue earned from activity tickets and passes. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for amounts collectible from revenue earned from patient services.
Amount of income tax revenue, not including income tax revenue from residents or nonresidents.
Revenue used for local community stabilization share.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Industrial Arts,Technology Education .
Increase (decrease) in accrued interest payable.
Governmental activities which are generally are financed through taxes, intergovernmental revenues, and other non-exchange revenues.
Revenues from community organizations or agencies for adult education programs.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General High School Education.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Physical Curriculum.
Revenues related to charter schools. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Intergovernmental agreement payable, due in more than one year.
Number of employees who work for both the police and fire department. This is not the sum of police personnel and fire personnel.
Used to identify type of program revenues which can be from charges for services and sales, from charges for operating grants and contributions, or from capital grants and contributions.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with establishing and administering policy for operating the school district. Do not include the Chief Business Official.
Increase (decrease) in amounts due to other governments.
Revenue in the form of gifts or donations from private sources.
Information about other expenditures for service or commodity, other purchased services.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Services purchased for cleaning (apart from services provided by government employees). Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other operating expense which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Respond to the question, Does the investment policy allow mutual funds with net asset values other than $1? For a response of Yes, respond TRUE; response of No, respond FALSE.
Used to identify type of program revenues which can be from charges for services and sales, from charges for operating grants and contributions, or from capital grants and contributions.
Increase (decrease) in amounts due to other funds.

Amount of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year, net of allowance for uncollectible amount that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Revenue earned from patient services, net of uncollectible amounts.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Physical Curriculum.
Other local revenues which are not classifiable above (Example: E-Rate). Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (Expense) Revenue for the activities of architects and engineers related to acquiring and improving sites and improving buildings. Charges are made to this program only for those preliminary activities which may or may not result in additions to school district property.

Amount of an entity's obligation to pay for goods and services that have been provided for which invoices have not yet been received or other incurred expenses the entity is obligated to pay within the normal operating cycle.
Amount of accumulation of periodic decreases in the estimated life of works of art and historical collections.

Short-term amounts due from component units. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Program revenues from charges for services. Charges for services arise from charges to customers, applicants, or others that purchase, use, or directly benefit from the goods, services, or privileges provided, or are otherwise directly affected by the services. May include revenues from charges for sales.
Increase (decrease) in claims payable.
Number of pension funds invested in derivatives at fiscal year-end.
Fund Balance, restricted for debt services.

Amounts of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Program revenues used for storm sewer services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

The net OPEB Asset is computed as the difference between the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments attributed to past periods of employee service and the OPEB plan’s fiduciary net position.
Information about other expenditures for service or commodity, supplies.

Inventories are carried at cost and consist of tickets for games in progress not yet sold to retailers and tickets for future games. The cost of tickets is charged to operations when the tickets are sold to retailers. The cost of unissued and returned tickets is written off at the end of each game.
Used to collect information about revenue designated for specific programs.
Expenditures for all types of insurance coverage, including property, liability, fidelity, unemployment compensation, workers’ compensation and student insurance.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Physical Curriculum.

Amounts paid to employees of the school district in either temporary or permanent positions for work performed in addition to the employee’s regular work assignment. Additional/extra duty pay/stipend includes compensation for such assignments as coaching, cocurricular activity sponsorship, supplemental pay for curriculum development, for night school, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in deposits.

The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received. This amount is net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
Information about school district revenue, state revenue.
Revenue earned from the lease or rental of public land.
Amounts paid to other governments for health.
Name of other operating revenue which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Amounts due from internal service funds within the local government unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about revenues for programs and functions on the Statement of Activities.
Revenue earned from attorney fee reimbursement charges.
Increase (decrease) in customer deposits payable.
Expenses for health and hospital programs.
Tax collection fees reported by funds established to collect delinquent taxes.
Amounts paid to state for health.

The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received.
Name of other capital asset, not being depreciated, net, which the reporting entity does not separately discloses in the same statement.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Family and Consumer Education.
Amounts paid by the school district for health, dental, vision, and cancer insurance coverage for its employees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for indigent defense, such as assigned counsel, Public defender, and Contractual arrangements.
Information about revenue for general government.

Expenses for activities concerned with overall administrative responsibility for a school or a combination of schools, for example, Office of the Principal Services and other support services for school administration.

Amount of liabilities for materials and services evidenced by vouchers which have been pre-audited and signed by the proper authority approving the liability. Debit upon payment of vouchers; credit for amounts approved for payment.
Increase (decrease) in compensated absences payable.
Amount of fee or grant for services provided to a number of people, such that the amount paid is determined by the number of patients, reported net of reinsurance expense.
Asset retirement obligations, due in more than one year.
Information about other expenditures for service or commodity, property.

Expenditures for purchase of all supplies (other than those listed below) for the operation of the government, including freight and cartage for the delivery of these supplies. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to villages.
Number of all other personnel that do not work for the police or the fire departments.
Program revenues used for general governments services legislative and executive, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Information about school district revenue, federal revenue.
The total amount of investments that are intended to be held for an extended period of time (longer than one operating cycle).
Revenue from a State source that is sent by a state or local agency other than State Department of Education.
Increase (decrease) in net pension liability.
Revenue earned from poison and drug center contracts.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Family and Consumer Education.
Charges for costs associated with student field trips, maintenance, and other internal services to the programs which benefit from the services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for non instructional services.
Amounts paid to other governments for hospitals.
Information about revenues for public safety.
Investments held for endowment.

Amount of safety net reimbursements which may include Medicaid Disproportionate Share Hospital (DSH) payments made to qualifying hospitals that serve a large number of Medicaid and uninsured patients.
Increase (decrease) in net pension and OPEB liability.

Cash advances to officials and/or employees of the local unit to cover anticipated expenses while traveling in an official capacity for the local unit. Upon completion of the travel, this account must be reimbursed for the entire amount of the advance.

Amount of liabilities for short-term lease. GASB 87 indicates that a short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement of the lease term, has a maximum possible term under the lease contract of 12 months (or less), including any options to extend, regardless of the probability of being exercised. For a lease that is cancelable by either the lessee or the lessor, such as a rolling month-to-month lease or a year-to-year lease, the maximum possible term is the non-cancelable period, including any notice periods. The lessor should recognize a liability if payments are received in advance. The lessee should recognize a liability for rent due if payments are to be made subsequent to the reporting period.
Advances from other funds that are within the same reporting entity that are payable from restricted resources.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Family and Consumer Education.
Amounts paid to state for hospitals.
Special items, sources of funds. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The excess of the face value of bonds over the amount received from the sale which remains to be amortized over the remaining life of the bonds.
Name of other capital assets, being depreciated, net, which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Liability for lottery prizes that have been awarded but not yet paid out.

Program revenues used for security of persons and property services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Security of Persons and Property services are provided by the City's Police Department which works to provide professional law enforcement services to keep citizens and property safe. Special emphasis is placed on community-oriented programs that will prevent crime and forge a partnership between officers and citizens.

Expenditures for the original purchase of land and the original improvements thereon. Purchases of air rights, mineral rights and the like are included here. Also included are special assessments against the government for capital improvements, such as streets, curbs and drains.

Expenses for activities concerned with preparing and interpreting descriptions of specific space requirements for the various learning experiences of students to be accommodated in a building. These specifications are interpreted to the architects and engineers in the early stages of blueprint development.
Increase (decrease) in OPEB liability.

Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. This account also includes other assets that are not depreciable.
Revenue from a federal source that is sent by a state or local agency other than the State Department of Education.
Expenses for local community stabilization share.

Amount of salaries, wages, and per diems paid to all full-time and part-times of the local unit. These amounts may be taken from W-3 and 1099 forms filed by the local unit at the end of the calendar year. Show total amount on the line for total wage and salary costs.
Expenditures for public schools services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about revenue for streets and highways.
Expenses for various cultural activities, fine arts, historical society, museums, etc.
Revenue earned from other government units to cover a portion of the cost of treating the medically indigent.
Fund Balance, restricted for capital improvements.
Current portion of lottery prize liability which is a present obligation to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Noncash change, net pension liability.
Premium and discounts.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Industrial Arts,Technology Education .
Amounts collected for and owed to a component unit by a local unit of government. Debit for all payments to the component unit; credit for all amounts owed to the component unit.
Program revenues used for highways and streets, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Services supporting the professional and technical development of school district personnel, including instructional, administrative, and service employees. Included are course registration fees (that are not tuition reimbursement), charges from external vendors to conduct training courses (at either school district facilities or off-site), and other expenditures associated with training or professional development by third-party vendors. All expenditures should be captured in this account regardless of the type or intent of the training course or professional development activity. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts paid to other governments for housing and urban development.
Noncash change, net OPEB liability.
Information about other financing sources and uses.

Revenue earned from tuition from other school districts and Board of Cooperative Educational Services (BOCES) within the state for instructional services provided This account includes: revenue received from the state Department of Education for out-of-district placed pupils and from other districts for excess costs for special education students; and, revenue received for tuition from other state public school districts and BOCES.
Description of the other contribution.
Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed.
Expenses associated with storm sewer services.
Increase (decrease) in other liabilities. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Amounts paid to state for housing and urban renewal.
Amount of collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture.
Warrants payable, due within one year.
Fund Balance, restricted for emergency reserves.
Office expenditures, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. As projects are completed, the cost is transferred from this account to the applicable capital asset account.
Expenses associated with elections.
Increase (decrease) in deferred inflows, pension.
Amounts paid to other governments for highways.
County revenue for foster care transportation. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Special items, uses of funds. This code is used to classify special items in accordance with GASB Statement 34. Included are transactions or events within the control of the school district administration that are either unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence. For some districts, this may include termination benefits resulting from workforce reductions; or costs in connection with an early retirement program offered to all employees represented in one or more classes of employees. Special items may also include events that are not within the control of the district. In the governmental funds, these items should be separately captioned or disclosed.

Inter-governmental receivable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis, for amounts due within one year.
Expenses for drunk driving case flow assistance.
Information about defined benefit plans.
Gain or loss realized from the sale of capital assets.
Grants, contributions and donations from federal governmental entities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for judicial activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Office equipment and furniture.

Expenditures for prosecuting attorney, used on the General Fund of county government. Its use is mandatory based on the revised statues of 1846 MCL 49.153 to MCL 49.160. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, consultants, equipment, etc., necessary for this officer to perform his/her statutory duties as prosecuting attorney for the county. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
State grants for sanitation purposes.
Cash received from special assessment levied.
Information about expenses for school district facilities acquisition and construction services.

Expenses for activities concerned with providing food to students and staff in a school or school district. This service area includes preparing and serving regular and incidental meals, lunches or snacks in connection with school activities and food delivery
Revenue earned from bond forfeitures and bond costs.
Timber rights are an interest in a property's timber that allows one to buy or sell the interest in the timber separately from the land.
Additions to Capital Assets Being Depreciated, Gross.
Amount of drain orders payable during the current fiscal year. Drain orders payable in a subsequent year or years are recorded as a deferred inflow.
Expenditures for fire prevention. Used on the General Fund or Fire Fund of local units of government that have such an activity reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from the Public School Finance Act of 1994 (as amended). Reported on a modified accrual basis.
General Employees Defined Benefit Plan.
Costs incurred for hospitalizations.
Expenditures for jail stores commissary services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue court from pro forfeiture mailing notice cost.

Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Land improvements is used to record depreciating or non-depreciating improvements. Depreciating records the cost of permanent improvements, other than building which add value to the land. Non-depreciating records improvements from construction and/or reconstruction projects.
State grants for the reimbursement of costs associated with special elections.
Water rights.
Contributions from local government units for gas, water and electric utilities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for general government activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.

Enter the six-digit municipal code as a continuous six-digit string without dashes or spaces. Note: find the local municode by visiting the Treasury website at the following link: http://www.michigan.gov/documents/treasury/Local_Units_Municodes_609070_7.xlsx.
Information about property tax including delinquent taxes, penalties, interest, fees, community-side special assessments.
Information about Notes Receivable.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund or in a separate Rubbish Collection Fund of a local unit of government. Its use is mandatory for any unit rendering this service. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, maintenance costs, equipment, and all other expenses necessary to render this service.
Net (expense) revenue for general government, elections.
Information about operating expenses for recreation and culture.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used for yard or storage purposes such as gasoline pumps and meters, fuel storage tanks, etc.
Expenditures. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Indicates if the employee retirement system(s) is managed by a financial institution. If yes, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for police activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Net (expense) revenue associated with elections.
Books and related materials.
The number of inactive members who have accumulated benefits but not retired, and are not yet receiving those benefits.
Receipts from property and other taxes levied specifically to finance the construction, acquisition, or improvement of capital assets.

Revenue earned from licenses and permits and franchise fees. License and permit fees exacted (either for revenue raising or for regulation) as a condition to the exercise of a business or non-business privilege.
Information about other school district uses.
Additions to capital assets, classified as being depreciated and not being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of additions or improvements to assets held under a lease arrangement.
Taxes levied in proportion to gross receipts on business activities of businesses, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about benefits expenses for OPEB and pension.
Expenses for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving new sites.
Other cash flows from investing activities.
Information about Loans Receivable.
Indicates if the local unit has a defined contribution plan. If yes, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

Expenditures for the activities of architects and engineers related to acquiring and improving sites and improving buildings. Charges are made to this program only for those preliminary activities which may or may not result in additions to school district property. Otherwise, charge these services to 4100, 4200, 4500 or 4600, as appropriate. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Money or assets received to recover the costs previously incurred.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for fire activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Expenses associated with state health benefit plan.
Machinery and equipment.
Identifier assigned to each participating local government by the Municipal Employees' Retirement System of Michigan (MERS).
Amounts paid by the school district for benefits on behalf of individuals who no longer are employed by the district.
Swamp land revenue from National Forest Reserve and Commercial Forest Reserve.
Revenue earned from sales.
Additions to capital assets being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Information about expenses for lottery activities.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for health and/or hospital purposes.
Information about Leases Receivable.
Program revenues used for elections, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Aggregate of all member contributions made for all defined contribution plans.
Amount of capital contributions.
Other Purchased Professional and Technical Services.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for combined public safety activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Easements, right of way.

Cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of natural resources which diminish in value by the removal of contents such as gravel pits, stone quarries, timber stands, brine wells, gas and oil wells, etc.
Number of retirees and beneficiaries receiving benefits. This does not include terminated employees who have accumulated benefits but are not yet retired and are not yet receiving those benefits.

Expenditures for recreation and culture activities, used on the General Fund or Park/Recreation Fund.
