It reflects expenditures incurred in park facilities, recreation programs, and cultural programs within a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from capital assets that are not being depreciated and not being amortized.
Information about nonoperating revenues and expenses.
Contributions from local government units for sanitation.

Other revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.

Expenditures for activities concerned with providing community services to students, staff or other community participants. Examples of this program are the operation of a community swimming pool and a recreation program for the elderly, a child care center, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from nursing home and hospital provider fees.
All other receivable amounts, not including tax, utility and assessments receivables, due from other governments and units, and due from other funds.
Information about revenues for school district support services.
Expenditures for parks and recreation activities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. As projects are completed, the cost is transferred from this account to the applicable capital asset account. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of shop machinery and equipment.
Indicates if the primary government has a defined benefit plan type of Police and Fire, or Public Safety.

Expenses for moneys Set‐Aside for specific purposes and identifies those portions of the fund balance (the excess of revenues over expenditures) which are segregated for future purposes and/or are not available to finance expenditures of the subsequent accounting period. Some reserves are statutorily mandated while others are in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles or practices.
Landfill.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for parking meters, off-street parking activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Cash inflows from tenants for rents, fees and deposits.
Information about nonoperating revenues.

Reductions from accumulated depreciation which is the accumulation of systematic and rational allocations of the estimated cost of using assets, on a historical basis, over the useful life of the assets.
Actual rate of return on OPEB assets, net of fees for the previous ten year period.

Expenditures incurred in making protective inspections, for example inspections for building, plumbing, electrical, gas, air conditioning, boiler, elevator, or weights and measures, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other financing sources.
Petty cash, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Charge back internal services to programs which benefit from the services.
Liabilities, deferred inflows of resources and fund balance/net position.
Expenses associated with facilities maintenance.

Other general revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. All revenues are general revenues unless required to be reported as program revenues. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Lease assets, right of use.

Expenditures for other recreation and culture activities not including parks and recreation, library and various cultural activities, fine arts, historical society, museums, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Police Defined Benefit Plan.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for corrections activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Expenditures for electricity and power services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for activities concerned with establishing and administering policy for operating the school district. Do not include the Chief Business Official here, but in Support Services – Business (Program 2500). Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash paid to other funds, except for interfund services used (paragraph .115f).
Reductions from Capital Asset Gross, defined as the sum of capital assets, not being depreciated and depreciable capital assets.

Amortization method for funding the system's unfunded actuarial accrued liabilities is level percent, level dollar, or other. Level percentage payments are should grow each year. Level dollar amortization is similar to a mortgage, the same payment is made every year. The amortization period is the timespan the actuary uses to pay down the unfunded liability.

Expenses for health and welfare, all other health and welfare not including health departments, boards and clinics, alcoholism and substance abuse, hospital, medical examiner, mental health, emergency services, child care activities, human services and medical care facility, area agency on aging, redevelopment and public housing, and veterans programs.

Other capital assets, being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization, which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Revenue earned from business license tax levied which is a fee paid to the government for the privilege of being licensed to do something (as selling liquor or practicing medicine).
Proceeds from issuing or refunding bonds, mortgages, notes, and other short or long-term borrowing clearly attributable to the acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets.
Net (expense) revenue court from sales.
Reductions from capital assets, total at historical cost.
Depletable assets.
Indicates if the employee retirement program is administered by self.
Information about grants, contributions and donations.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for other public safety activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Unamortized premiums on investments, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other Miscellaneous Uses of Funds.
Net (expense) revenue associated with public ways and facilities services.
Funded ratio for uniform assumptions is based on the ratio of assets (actuarial value of plan assets) to actuarially accrued liabilities on a plan-year basis as reported using uniform assumptions.
Information about revenues for school district non instructional services.
Expenditures for contingency services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Elementary Education.
Expenses associated with other development services when the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Amounts owed to the local unit from any source, includes Receivables and amounts due from other governments and other funds.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Middle/Junior High School Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
State grants for highways and streets.
Other general revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. All revenues are general revenues unless required to be reported as program revenues.
State grants for highways and streets.

Expenses for parks policing used on the General Fund or a Parks/Recreation Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, uniforms, materials, and equipment necessary to police park operations or recreation programs of a local unit.
Indicates if the local unit has a hybrid plan. If yes, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

Revenue for activities designed to assess and improve the well‐being of students and to supplement the teaching process. These services pertain to interaction between students and teachers by designing the educational program for the needs of individual students.
Reductions from capital assets, classified as being depreciated and not being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for streets and highways. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Other capital asset.
Information about nonoperating expenses.
Legal expenditures, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Investing activities include making and collecting loans (except program loans, as discussed in paragraph .116) and acquiring and disposing of debt or equity instruments.
Expenses associated with convention center services.
Amount of other long term assets.
Taxes imposed upon the transfer of property at death or gifts made in anticipation of death.
Unamortized discounts on investments, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Unit Type which can be Drain District, Authority, School, Township, Village, Hospital Finance Authority, Library, City, County, Road Commission, ISD, Community College, or School Academy.

Contracted expenditures to reimburse other educational agencies for instructional services to students residing in the legal boundaries described for the paying school district. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenues for land surveying activities performed by a surveyor to perpetuate a previously monumented original public land survey corner, protracted public land survey corner, or property controlling corner.
Reductions from capital assets being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Indicates if the primary government has a defined benefit plan type of Police.
Other capital asset.
Intergovernmental accounts payable.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for sanitation and solid waste. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Costs for property, liability and other types of insurance including workers' compensation.
Revenue from a federal source that comes direct from the federal government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from tuition from welfare agencies and private sources for educational services provided. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenses for property.
Expenditures incurred for other protection activities for example civil defense, militia and armories, traffic engineering, and flood control, reported on a modified accrual basis.
A sum of all general revenues.
Costs incurred for transportation services.

Expenditures after the property tax foreclosure process within the delinquent tax revolving fund. The act states the foreclosing governmental unit must deposit the proceeds from the sale of tax delinquent property into a "restricted account" created for each year a property sale is held. The restricted accounts should be established within the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund based on the year of the sale. This activity is used to record the sale proceeds and the authorized expenditures of the proceeds. When the forfeited property is sold, the proceeds from the sale should be recorded in the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund.
Amounts owed and payable to third parties related to connection services performed.
Revenue earned from use and admission fees.
Used to collect and trigger information about the pension or OPEB plan.
Revenue from redemptions and reconveyances, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from property transfer tax levied which is a charge levied on the transfer of ownership or title to property from one individual or entity to another.
Transfers within accounts for capital assets, not being depreciated.

Amounts owed to the local government unit by users of utility services and water services. This account is debited when the amount of utility bills is due; credited when payments are received, or adjustments are approved.
Other capital asset.
Fire defined benefit plan member.
Payments made by the State to PERA on behalf of school districts, BOCES and charter schools.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for sewerage. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.

Specific costs of services that a regulatory agency permits a U.S. public utility (usually an energy company) to recover in future rates. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for permanent improvements other than buildings that add value to land, for example, fences, landscaping, parking, and retaining walls.
Net (expense) revenue for general government services.

Expenditures for intergovernmental activities. Inter-governmental, a fourth character classification, is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an intermediary in federally financed programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts paid for goods and services not otherwise classified.
Program revenues for health and hospital programs.

Services supporting the instructional program and its administration Included are curriculum improvement services, counseling and guidance services, library and media support services, and contracted instructional services.
Indicate if the local government made all required retiree insurance premiums for the year. If the local government did, report as TRUE; if it did not, report as FALSE.
Amounts paid for scholarships awarded to students to pursue post-secondary educational opportunities.
Transfers within accounts for accumulated depreciation.
Other capital asset.
Revenue earned from friend of the court statutory handling fee. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Indicates if the employee retirement system(s) is managed by MERS. If yes, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Expenses for the reimbursement of costs associated with special elections.
Information about revenues for school district facilities acquisition and construction.
Revenue from sales and use tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
A consumption of net assets by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for water. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.

Revenue for activities concerned with providing food to students and staff in a school or school district. This service area includes preparing and serving regular and incidental meals, lunches or snacks in connection with school activities and food delivery

Expenditures for emergency management, homeland security, used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries of emergency management personnel, travel, emergency management supplies and equipment, and other expenditures essential to the emergency management program of a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of liabilities not elsewhere included in the statement that are incurred to vendors for goods and services received, and accrued liabilities classified as other, payable within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
Cash receipts from grants for specific activities that are considered to be operating activities of the grantor government.
Transfers within accounts for Capital Asset Gross, defined as the sum of capital assets, not being depreciated and depreciable capital assets.
Amortization period for the system which is the timespan the actuary uses to pay down the unfunded liability.
Other capital asset.

Revenue earned from documents transfer tax levied which is collected when real property changes hands or is sold through the public records. Counties, cities, or municipalities can assess this tax on real estate transactions within a jurisdiction.
Represents other cash and cash equivalents that the reporting entity does not separately disclose. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for electric utilities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Aggregate amount of net pension liability for the government entity. If overfunded, report as a negative amount.
Fees from other sources such as welfare agencies and private sources for transporting students to and from school and school activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from all other services rendered charges.

Used to classify transactions which are not properly recorded as expenditures to the school district but require budgetary or accounting control These include redemption of principal and interest on long-term debt, housing authority obligations, and fund transfers.

Cash received from other funds except (1) those amounts that are clearly attributable to acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets (paragraph .122c), (2) interfund services provided (paragraph .114b), and (3) interfund reimbursements (paragraph .114d).
Information about contributions.
Transfers within accounts for capital assets, total at historical cost.

Expenditures for snowmobile law enforcement, used on the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of governments. It reflects all expenditures such as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., incidental to enforcement of the snowmobile law. The State reimburses some of the expenditures charged to this activity; such reimbursement should be recorded as well.
State capital grants.
Amounts due to cities.
Amount of premium amortization related to the issuance of debts that are due in future reporting periods.
Revenue earned from transfer stamps tax levied which is a transaction fee imposed on the transfer of title to property. Transfer taxes are not considered deductible real estate taxes.
Other capital asset.

Enter the amount of premiums paid on behalf of the retirants. This is the annual cost paid to provide health care insurance or benefits to retirees. If the local government provides a self-insured plan to retirees, provide the annual claims costs, in addition to any catastrophic insurance premium payment. This amount does not include retiree contributions.
Cash and securities that are set aside to satisfy contractual or regulatory requirements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Indicates if the primary government has a defined benefit plan type of Fire.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for airports. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Amounts due to general funds within the same reporting entity.
Information about transfers.
Information about net (expenses) revenues for non instructional services.

Expenditures for water safety council is on the General Funds and reflects appropriations to the water safety council or such expenditures as salaries, travel expenditures, supplies, and equipment necessary for the operation of a local unit water safety council. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from hotel and motel tax levied.
Revenue for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving new sites.
Amount of unpaid utility bills which have been placed on the tax roll in accordance with statutory provisions. A detailed subsidiary account for each resident must be maintained.
Revenue from the operation of the food service program. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Transfers within accounts for capital assets, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Cost incurred for lottery game costs.
Other capital asset.
Expenses associated with township properties.
Enter the system's actuarially determined contribution (ADC) as calculated using uniform assumptions.
Repayments or refundings of amounts borrowed specifically to acquire, construct, or improve capital assets.
Net (expense) revenue associated with health and hospital activities.
Police and Fire or Public Safety Defined Benefit Plan.
Net (expense) revenue for drunk driving case flow assistance.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for public transportation. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Elementary Education.

Revenue earned from sales and use tax levied on selective items such as motor fuel, tobacco products or alcoholic beverages. Sales and use is defined as a tax on the storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item or service on which no sales tax has been paid. Use tax is a complementary or compensating tax to the sales tax and does not apply if the sales tax was charged. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Value of a change in an accounting principle which is a change in a method used, such as using a different depreciation method or switching between LIFO to FIFO inventory valuation methods.
Information about miscellaneous other revenues.

Revenue earned from vehicles tax levied which is a vehicle license cost recovery fee based on the estimated average per day per vehicle portion of total annual vehicle licensing, titling, and registration costs or as otherwise defined under applicable law.
Grants, contributions and donations from state governmental entities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other capital asset.
Enter the four-digit year of the most recently completed fiscal year (20xx). Biennial filers are required to file each year.
Resources received from grantors before eligibility requirements are met.
Transfers within accounts for capital assets being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Indicates if the primary government has a defined benefit plan type of Other.
Revenue earned from fees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions from local government units for health and hospitals.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for hospitals and hospital operations. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Expenses incurred in sanitation landfill and solid waste.
Amounts due and payable related to grants given out by the entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from meals tax levied which apply to purchases of prepared foods for immediate consumption, and not just to meals eaten in a restaurant. Meals tax does not apply to groceries or other non-prepared foods.
Amounts paid for goods or services not properly classified in one of the objects included above Payments for refunds of prior year revenues are charged to this account.

Other revenues not including interest and rents, fine and forfeits, charges for services, government grants and contributions, licenses and permits, special assessments, taxes, reimbursements, sale of capital assets, public and private contributions, refunds and rebates, and miscellaneous other revenue.
Revenue earned from lottery license application fees.
Other capital asset.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities designed to assess and improve the well‐being of students and to supplement the teaching process. These services pertain to interaction between students and teachers by designing the educational program for the needs of individual students.
Contributions from local government units for transit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue court from use and admission fees.
Amount of revenue bonds maturing during the current fiscal year, payable from restricted resources.
Amount of bonds maturing during the current fiscal year.
Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.

Indicate if the local government set aside funds equal to the normal cost for new employees hired after June 30, 2018, by selecting yes or no. If the retirement system does not have any new employees hired after June 30, 2018 or the plan has been closed to new hires before June 30, 2018, select Not Applicable. Funds set aside should be placed into a qualified trust or restricted account for future benefit payments. Normal cost represents the annual service cost of retirement health benefits as earned during active employment of employees of the local government in the applicable fiscal year, using an individual entry-age normal and level pay actuarial cost method.
Other Defined Benefit Plan.
Amount of customer deposits payable in more than one year, and that are payable from restricted assets.
Net (expense) revenue associated with public assistance services.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for welfare. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Accrued expenses payable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from franchise income tax levied which is a tax paid by certain enterprises that want to do business in some states. Also called a privilege tax, it gives the business the right to be chartered and/or to operate within that state.
Expense for energy, including gas, oil, coal, gasoline, and services received from public and private utility companies.
Other long term investments excluding net pension asset, net OPEB asset, advances to other funds and advances to other units of government.

Funds that a district must send to the Division of Vocational Rehabilitation (DVR) This payment supports the DVR request for federal government grant award dollars that will be provided to the district School to Work Alliance Program (SWAP) is the grant program with this type of arrangement. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue associated with other development services when the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Other capital asset.
Revenues from community organizations or agencies for other community service activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cost of issue of bonds and securities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Full-time, part-time, and prorated portions of the costs for work performed by employees of the school district who are hired on a temporary or substitute basis.

Expenditures for grand jury, used on the General Fund of any unit responsible for the expenditures incurred by a grand jury. Expenditures include legal fees, consultant fees, travel, supplies, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount due to others payable in more than one year, and that are payable from restricted assets.
Indicate if the defined benefit pensions plans are audited by an independent CPA. If plans are audited by an independent CPE, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for housing and redevelopment. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Advances from component unit, reported on a modified accrual basis that are due in more than one year.
Indicate whether each division in the OPEB system is closed to new employees. . If it is, report as TRUE; If it is not, report as FALSE.
Net (expense) revenue associated with convention center services.
Taxes levied in proportion to gross receipts on business activities of businesses.
Description of the capital asset.
Interest payments to lenders and other creditors on amounts borrowed or credit extended for purposes other than acquiring, constructing, or improving capital assets.
Revenue earned internal to the district from other funds or programs for services provided. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Summation of assets and deferred outflows of resources.

Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. See GASB COD Appendix B under the summary. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from the employer. This may be different than the annual required contribution (ARC) due to timing or other reasons.
Revenue earned from parking facilities including garages and meters.
Revenue earned from other taxes levied.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for all other health and welfare. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
The health care inflation assumption used for the next year that the actuary uses to project expected growth rates in medical premiums and expenditures. Use the non-Medicare rate for the next year.
Net (expense) revenue associated with transportation services.
All other grants, contributions and donations earned from state governmental entities.
Information about net (expenses) revenues for facilities, acquisition and construction services.
Expenditures for fire department training. Used on the General Fund or Fire Fund of local units of government that have such an activity reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from business license tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Program revenues used for planning and zoning, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Cities, villages and townships designate neighborhood areas for the purpose of planning and carrying out local public improvements for the prevention of blight within such areas; to authorize assistance in carrying out plans for local improvements by the acquisition and disposal of real property in such areas; to provide for the combining of neighborhood improvements that benefit the entire neighborhood into improvement projects; to provide for the establishment of local assessment districts coterminous with the neighborhood boundaries; and to prescribe the methods of financing the exercise of these powers.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with providing food to students and staff in a school or school district. This service area includes preparing and serving regular and incidental meals, lunches or snacks in connection with school activities and food delivery
Obligations incurred by the local government unit to remediate environmental and disposal issues to be paid in future reporting periods.
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from employees.
The sum of all expenses plus financing sources.
Unavailable revenue. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

All revenue generated from taxes which are mandatory contributions levied on individuals or corporations by a government entity—whether local, regional, or national. Tax revenues finance government activities, including public works and services such as roads and schools, or programs.
Costs for renting or short-term leasing land, buildings, equipment and vehicles.
Infrastructure.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for parks and recreation. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
The long-term trend rate assumption used by the actuary for health care inflation. Use the non-Medicare long-term trend rate.
Revenue earned from all other sales, use and admission fees.

Employer’s share of Public Employees Retirement Association (PERA) or local employee retirement system paid by the school district, including the amount paid for employees assigned to federally funded programs. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Repayments or refundings of amounts borrowed specifically to acquire, construct, or improve capital assets.
Net (expense) revenue court from jury demand fees.

Expenditures for animal shelter and dog warden is on the General Fund and reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel expenditures, office supplies, dog tags and supplies, dog food, animal shelter maintenance and other supplies, equipment, and expenditures necessary for the operation of the animal shelter. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts owed by a local unit of government to the primary government where such amounts are due in years subsequent to the current fiscal year. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases.

Ratio of ADC (as calculated using uniform assumptions) to governmental fund revenues (as reported from the most recent audited financial statements). If a local government has multiple plans, all ADC amounts are added together to calculate the ratio to governmental fund revenues.
All other long term liabilities, excluding long-term debt, advances from other funds, other advances, unearned revenues, net pension liability, OPEB obligation and accrued benefits and compensation.

Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is constrained by formal actions of the local unit’s highest level of decision-making authority as to the purposes for which it may be used. Sometimes a fund’s entire fund balance will be committed, but more often only a portion will be committed. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Mains and connections.
Program revenues used for cemetery, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.

Expenses for parks lighting, used on the General Fund or a Park and Recreation Fund. It reflects all expenditures necessary to provide proper lighting of parks or recreation facilities, such as utility poles, light bulbs, payment of utility bills, and any other necessary supplies, materials or equipment related to the lighting of parks.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for library services. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Net (expense) revenue court from bond forfeitures and bond costs.
Fees paid to fiscal agents. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for announcements in professional publications, newspapers or broadcasts over radio and television. These expenditures include advertising for such purposes as personnel recruitment, legal ads, new and used equipment, and sale of property.
Amount, excluding unamortized premium (discount) and debt issuance cost, of long-term debt due in more than one year, and that is payable from restricted assets. Excludes lease obligation.
Any special assessment that is assessed on a community-wide basis, such an Act 33 public safety millage, should be reported as a tax. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with education services.
Information about net (expenses) revenues for other school district uses.
Buildings and equipment.

Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving new sites.

Long term interest, short-term interest or interest on leases. See “Capital Leases,” or “Leases, after GASB Statement No. 87” for information about recording leases prior to and after the effective date for GASB Statement #87. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of accounts receivable which is estimated will never be collected.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for other recreation and culture activities. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Cash payments to landlords.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for welfare purposes.
An acquisition of net assets related to property tax collection that applies to a future reporting period(s).

Net (Expense) Revenue from licenses and permits and franchise fees. License and permit fees exacted (either for revenue raising or for regulation) as a condition to the exercise of a business or non-business privilege.
Net (expense) revenue from charges for services, parking facilities including garages and meters.
Buildings and improvements.
Allowance for inter governmental receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for inter governmental receivable, due within one year, estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

All revenue and expenditures after the property tax foreclosure process goes into activity 254 within the delinquent tax revolving fund. The act states the foreclosing governmental unit must deposit the proceeds from the sale of tax delinquent property into a "restricted account" created for each year a property sale is held. The restricted accounts should be established within the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund based on the year of the sale. This activity (Activity # 254--Delinquent Tax Property Sales) is used to record the sale proceeds and the authorized expenditures of the proceeds. When the forfeited property is sold, the proceeds from the sale should be recorded in the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund under revenue account number 642 "Charge for Services-Sales. "Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for other functions. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Revenue from property transfer tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash and other assets or resources commonly identified as those that are reasonably expected to be realized in cash or sold or consumed within a year.
Enter the fiscal year end month for the local government unit.
State grants for all public safety activities, including drunk driving case flow assistance, drug case information management account, crime victims rights, and court equity.
Buildings.
Type of employees participating in the pension plan, which can be General Employees, Fire, Police, Public Safety, Teachers, Elected Officials, Judges, Mixed or Other.

Net (expense) revenue for land surveying activities performed by a surveyor to perpetuate a previously monumented original public land survey corner, protracted public land survey corner, or property controlling corner.

Cash and cash equivalents and investments includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
Allowance for notes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts due from other government entities such as cities, counties, libraries, road commissions, schools, townships, villages, state and federal government, that are outside of the government's reporting entity that are not yet collected.

Capital outlay expenditures of all funds for other capital outlay. In reporting disbursements for capital outlay, report only the amounts actually expended or incurred for this purpose during the fiscal year including construction in progress. Note: These disbursements are classified and reported as increases to capital assets in the unit of government’s accounting records and audit report.
Revenue from transfer stamps tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues used for crime victims' rights.

Program revenues that arise from charges to customers, applicants, or others who purchase, use, or directly benefit from the goods, services, or privileges provided, or are otherwise directly affected by the services.

Net (Expense) Revenue for moneys Set‐Aside for specific purposes and identifies those portions of the fund balance (the excess of revenues over expenditures) which are segregated for future purposes and/or are not available to finance expenditures of the subsequent accounting period. Some reserves are statutorily mandated while others are in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles or practices.
Indicates if the fund triggers underfunded status as defined by Public Act 202 of 2017. If it does trigger underfunded status, report as TRUE; if it does not, report as FALSE.
Net (expense) revenue for fire marshal.
Equipment.
Change cash.

Expenditures for security of persons and property services. a) It includes police agencies for preventing, controlling, or reducing crime; law enforcement activities of sheriff and constable offices; coroners; medical examiners; vehicular inspection activities; traffic control and safety activities; lock-up operations and excludes contributions to a local police pension fund, local court activities, and local correction activities. b) It includes firefighting and fire prevention and ambulance and paramedic services handled by the fire department, contributions of volunteer fire units, but excludes contributions to a local fire pension fund, forest fire protection amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for security of persons and property services. a) It includes police agencies for preventing, controlling, or reducing crime; law enforcement activities of sheriff and constable offices; coroners; medical examiners; vehicular inspection activities; traffic control and safety activities; lock-up operations and excludes contributions to a local police pension fund, local court activities, and local correction activities. b) It includes firefighting and fire prevention and ambulance and paramedic services handled by the fire department, contributions of volunteer fire units, but excludes contributions to a local fire pension fund, forest fire protection amounts.

Cash paid as grants or subsidies to other governments or organizations, except those for specific activities that are considered to be operating activities of the grantor government (paragraph .115d).

Amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from friend of the court service fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Indicate the entity that administers the employee retirement system, which can be insurance company, financial institution, self, or MERS.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities that are financed and operated for a manner similar to private business enterprises – where the stated intent is that the costs are financed or recovered primarily through user charges. Food Services should not be charged here. One example could be the school district bookstore or before‐ or after‐school day care programs
State grants for health and/or hospitals purposes.

Cash payments to lenders and other creditors for fees directly related to the issuance or refunding bonds, mortgage notes, and other short- or long-term borrowing clearly attributable to the acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets.
Unamortized discounts on investments.
Road equipment.
Revenue from documents transfer tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Enter the contact name of the Chief Administrative Officer, or designee.
Allowance for amount of lease receivable due within one year and estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

All other grants, contributions and donations earned from federal governmental entities which are used to help finance a broad range of services, excludes grants specified for sanitation, health, welfare, recreation and culture, CDBG, public safety and capital grants.
Program revenues associated with government operations which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Waterworks and sewage system.
Information about all other short term debt.
Enter the title of the contact if not Chief Administrative Officer.

Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Taxes imposed upon the transfer of property at death or gifts made in anticipation of death, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with operations.
Revenue bonds payable due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Proceeds from other sources not elsewhere classified. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of transfer payments which is a one-way payment to a person who has given or exchanged no money, good, or service for it, for example, Social Security, Medicaid, and unemployment insurance.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Instructional Media. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Cash Equivalents.
Information about Net Position on the Statement of Activities.

Amount of payments withheld that are a percentage of milestone payments owed to a subcontractor or vendor pending full completion of project and resolution of any defects. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Used to represent data reported in the Statement of Net Position.
Federal capital grants.
Expenses for community promotion expense.
Expenditures for other welfare services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Changes in net position which is the difference in net position between the beginning and end of the reporting period.
Information about taxes, utility, and assessments receivables.
Unamortized discounts on bonds sold by the local unit, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Distributive/Marketing Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about sanitation landfill, and solid waste.
Information about expenditures for human services and medical care facilities.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Art. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Interest and penalties reported by funds established to collect delinquent taxes.
Used to collect information found on a Statement of Net Position, Primary Government.
Revenues earned from sale of fuel.
Expenditures for trustee fees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about receivables.
Amount of debt payments related to the general obligation bonds, due in more than one year, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cost incurred for promotion, public relations, and point of sale.
Amount of accrued interest and penalties on taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Costs for providing routine and preventive maintenance as well as operating services, such as janitorial services, elevator service, extermination of rodents and household pests, and rubbish and garbage elevator service, extermination of rodents and household pests, and rubbish and garbage collection.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in English Language Arts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture, reported on a modified accrual basis due in more than one year.
Information about amounts that are due from governments.

Expenditures for health and welfare, Department of Human Services, used on the General Fund or the Social Welfare Fund. In the General Fund, it represents the county appropriation to the Social Welfare Fund. In the Social Welfare Fund, it reflects county expenditures paid on behalf of the county’s poor and indigent, through various assistance programs. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenues of the Social Welfare Fund from other county revenues. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund or in a separate Rubbish Collection Fund of local units of government. Its use is mandatory by any unit having such a department. It reflects such expenses as salaries, travel, office supplies, equipment, and other expenses applicable to the operation of a sanitation department. It may also be used to reflect revenues generated by the sanitation department.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Other General Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash segregated for capital reserves.
Costs incurred for claims and judgments.
Revenue from trailer tax.
Expenditures or assessments for membership in professional or other organizations. This includes any fee assessed for membership. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts paid for items that are consumed, worn out, or deteriorated through use; or items that lose their identity through fabrication or incorporation into different or more complex units or substances.
Revenue earned from current personal property tax levied.
Operating grants given to the local government unit to subsidize the entity's operation.
Name of other fund balance committed which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Information about all other receivables, not including tax, utility, assessments, due from other governments or funds.
Information about expenses for public works, non Act 51.
Amount of forfeiture certificate recording fees due to the county in accordance with 1999 PA 123. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about trade receivable.
Expenditures for director fees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Costs incurred for professional services and supplies to support the local government unit's operation.
Information about expenses for recreation and parks.
Revenue earned from leases, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Agriculture. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about other current assets.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Foreign Languages. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Taxes levied for other governments that are to be collected and distributed to the other governments. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Other Accounts Receivable.
Expenses for state institutions.

Compulsory levy made against certain properties to defray all or part of the cost of a specific capital improvement or service deemed to benefit primarily those properties. A special assessment tax is a surtax levied on property owners to pay for specific local infrastructure projects such as the construction or maintenance of roads or sewer lines.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund or in a separate DPW construction project Fund, e.g., within the capital projects fund category, DPW Revolving Fund within the Internal Service Fund Category or Operation and Maintenance Fund within the Enterprise Fund Category. Its use is mandatory for any unit having a department of public works. Within the General Fund, it reflects such expenditures as salaries, office supplies, travel, maintenance, and equipment of an administrative nature. Within other funds, it reflects all costs chargeable to a specific DPW project, or which costs may or may not be recoverable from another unit or government. It may also be used to reflect revenues generated by the DPW.
Allowances for refunds.
Information about inventory.
Information about tax and tax-related revenues.
Other long term investments excluding net pension asset, net OPEB asset, advances to other funds and advances to other units of government. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in accounts receivable and lease receivable.
Expenditures for management fees. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about state grants for general state aid grants.

Costs incurred to support the operation of the cafeteria, bookstore, student organizations, athletics, and other related activities. It also includes all equipment, materials, supplies, and costs that are necessary to support this function.
Unamortized discounts on bonds, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about tenant accounts receivables.

Information about capital assets, which includes land, improvements to land, buildings, building improvements, vehicles, machinery, equipment, works of art and historical treasures, infrastructure, and all other tangible or intangible assets that are used in operations and that have initial useful lives extending beyond a single reporting period.
Cost of road materials stockpiled in warehouses, pits or yards which are used for construction or maintenance of the county road system.
Expenditures for landscaping and maintenance. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for general government purposes.
Expenditures for bank charges and fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
All other long term liabilities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Unamortized charge, refunding bonds. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about intergovernmental revenue from federal government.

Cumulative total balance of all tenant charges due, owed and outstanding, such as dwelling rent, maintenance charges, late fees, excess utility charges, and other charges owed to the PHA. This line includes the gross amount due from tenants excluding amounts owed due to participants that committed fraud or misrepresentation and now owe additional rent for periods or retroactive rent.
Restricted net position for recreation and culture.
Revenue from a subsidy which is a direct or indirect payment, usually in the form of a cash payment from the government or a targeted tax cut.
Operating revenue, not elsewhere classified. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Business. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Operating revenue from contributions and premiums.
Amounts owed to the local unit from any source.
Restricted net position for parks and recreation.
Amount of securities lending obligations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for general government.
The excess of net book value above the amount received (trade or cash) at disposal. This object is used in proprietary funds only.
Name of other deferred inflows which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Grants, contributions and donations earned from state governmental entities.
Expenses incurred for refunds and rebates.
Information about land and improvements.

Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government. Does not represent receivables due from other governments or funds, tax, utility or assessments receivables. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about customer and other government receivables.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Mathematics. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of special assessment debt with government commitment, dur in more than one year, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions made to other governments.
Information about other expenditures.
State grants for indigent defense, such as assigned counsel, Public defender, and Contractual arrangements.
Increase (decrease) in deferred inflows, leases.

The portion of tax anticipation notes or other notes to be paid by the local unit during the current year. A note payable is an unconditional written promise signed by the maker (authorized local unit officials) to pay a certain sum of money on demand or at a fixed or determinable time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for snow removal. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about all other capital assets.
Transfers which are inflows of assets to a fund. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in road work such as motor graders, cranes, rollers, etc.
Other expenditures which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions from local government units for public safety.
Regulatory liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about special assessment revenues.
Allowance for chargebacks. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue from taxes imposed upon certain classified personal property, such as motor vehicles, which tax is computed in accordance with state schedules applicable to each sale of personal property. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from customers and other government units.
Tuition and fees (less refunds, remissions, and exemptions) assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
Revenue from national forest reserve taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts from due from the State not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The interest payments on matured debt and loans that are due and payable within the normal operating cycle. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Costs incurred for professional and contractual services to support the local government unit's operation.
Name of other deferred outflows of resources which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Noncurrent assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues from health related fees for example vital statistics, health and inspection fees, hospital fees, and animal control and shelter fees.

Revenue earnings from interest income, is any income made from lending borrowers money. Regular taxable interest is taxed as ordinary income, just like an individual retirement account (IRA) or retirement plan distribution.1 This means interest income is added to the taxpayer’s other ordinary income.
Information about government claims receivable.
Information about liabilities, deferred outflows and net position.

Payables for others which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Payables are amounts owed on open accounts to private persons or organizations for goods and services furnished to a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Long-term connection fees related to utility services provided that have been earned but not yet received.
Amount of other long term assets, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Represents amounts owed to the local unit by users of utility services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cost incurred for interest expense imputed on annuitized prize liability.
Information about Current Liabilities.
Derivative instruments, a liability, noncurrent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues from interest and dividends.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received on special assessments. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable on special assessments.

Expenses incurred in the General Fund or in the Park/Recreation Fund of any local unit of government. It is for use by units which include all recreation and parks expenditures within this single activity. When used by a unit, it will reflect all expenditures of a park or recreation program including administration, park facilities, supervision, policing, lighting and maintenance of facilities, and any other parks or recreation activities. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenue earned by the parks or recreation department from other General Fund revenues.
Name of other fund balance nonspendable which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Health Occupations Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Operating revenue, not elsewhere classified.
Information about Long Term Liabilities.

Represents lease contracts payable in the current period that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenses for other public works for enterprise activities.

A security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses for purchased infrastructure assets by the school district. These items include water/sewer systems, roads, bridges, and other assets that have significantly longer useful lives than other capital assets.
Tax liens receivable.
Revenue from royalties.
Information about long term debt.
Expenses for other welfare services.

Governments should establish a policy that defines operating revenues and expenses that is appropriate to the nature of the activity being reported, disclose it in the summary of significant accounting policies, and use it consistently from period to period. A consideration for defining a proprietary fund's operating revenues and expenses is how individual transactions would be categorized for purposes of preparing a statement of cash flows using Section 2450.
Revenue earned from interest and penalties on special assessments. Used for governmental funds accounts, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Physical Curriculum. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Special asessment liens receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for conservation, recreation, parks and cultural services, which can include provision and support of recreational and cultural-scientific facilities and activities including golf courses, play fields, playgrounds, public beaches, swimming pools, tennis courts, parks, auditoriums, stadiums, auto camps, recreation piers, marinas, botanical gardens, galleries, museums, and zoos. Also includes building and operation of convention centers and exhibition halls. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about other advances.
Information about all other services rendered charges.
Costs incurred for activities related to special assessments.
Sum of all long term liabilities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about taxes receivable, net of allowances.

Amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.

That part of a scholarship or fellowship that is used to pay institutional charges such as tuition and fees or room and board charges. Scholarships and fellowships include Outright grants-in-aid, trainee stipends, tuition and fee waivers, and prizes awarded to students by the institution, including Pell grants. Awards to undergraduate students are most commonly referred to as "scholarships" and those to graduate students as "fellowships." These awards do not require the performance of services while a student (such as teaching) or subsequently as a result of the scholarship or fellowship. The term does not include loans to students (subject to repayment), College Work-Study Program (CWS), or awards granted to a parent of a student because of the parent's faculty or staff status. Also not included are awards to students where the selection of the student recipient is not made by the institution.
Expenditures for retirement benefits to retirees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses for soil conservation, used in enterprise activities. It reflects such expenditures as salaries and wages, travel, supplies used in the program, equipment, equipment maintenance, and other expenditures necessary to perform this activity.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Family and Consumer Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about deferred inflows of resources
Amount of tax levied upon the sale or consumption of goods that are not yet collected.
Amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about cash flows from operating activities.
Information about water systems.
Used only in the Drain Fund of counties and its balance reflects drain orders payable for years subsequent to the current fiscal year.
Expenses for Watershed Council for any local unit supporting a watershed project, used in enterprise activities.
Amounts due from Federal Government, but not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
General Institution includes legal services, general insurance, remodeling, internet provider costs, and other items benefitting the institution.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Industrial Arts,Technology Education . Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from collection fees.
Information about assessments receivable.
Cost incurred for other lottery costs. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Significant transactions or other events within the control management that are either unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence.
Revenues earned from welfare-related fees such as institutional charges.
Cash inflows from sales of goods or services, including receipts from collection of accounts receivable and both short- and long-term notes receivable from customers arising from those sales.
Other noncurrent assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents unpaid utility bills which have been placed on the tax roll in accordance with statutory provisions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from court related charges. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cost of materials and services rendered.
Expenditures for community services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about cash flows from non capital financing activities.
Revenue earned from traffic violations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due related to operating leases and rental agreements.
Nonoperating revenues from connection fees.

Other noncurrent liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have occurred outside the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for lake improvements used in Enterprise activities.
Information about other long term assets.
Expenses for operations and maintenance.

The cost of construction or acquisition of a water system. This account may be pointed off to separate the various elements of a water system such as water lines, water mains, pumping plant, water treatment plant, etc.
Amount of payments related to contracts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about restricted assets.
The capital outlay related to the acquisition of a lease under GASB Statement No. 88.

Net position represents the difference between all other elements in a statement of net position and should be displayed in three components namely net investment in capital assets, restricted (distinguishing between major categories of restrictions), and unrestricted. Use PeriodEnd or PeriodStart labels to represent end of period or start of period balance.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, pupil activities.
Revenues from interest and dividends, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Music. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The amount of amortization expense recognized in the current period.
Cash received from real estate taxes and corporate personnel property replacement taxes collected.
Revenue earned or lost through investments, reported on a modified accrual basis..
Costs incurred for bond issuance and recognition of a portion of the unamortized bond discount for the reporting period.
Information about advances, noncurrent.
Amounts owed to the local unit from any source, includes Receivables and amounts due from other governments and other funds. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for state trunkline overhead. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about school district revenue from local sources, other revenue.
Information about cash flows from capital and related financing activities.
Depletion, depreciation, and amortization expense recognized in the current period.
Information about lease assets.

Amounts for specific revenues or gains that a local government unit to defer to be recognized within the next reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Housing assistance payments (HAP) for the Housing Choice Voucher (HCV) or similar type program paid or accrued to the owners of dwelling units leased to eligible families. Also included are HAP related expenses such as contributions to FSS escrow accounts, utility reimbursements, and mortgage payments paid using HAP subsidy for a HCV homeownership program. In addition this account includes, where applicable, HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for vacancies during and after rent-up pursuant to a housing assistance payments contract, and HAP payments paid or accrued to owners for reimbursement pursuant to the provisions of the housing assistance contract for any unpaid rent or damages caused by the tenants.
Information about accounts receivable, noncurrent.
