Revenues that are generated by a government itself, such as tax revenues and water and sewer charges. Investment income is also an own-source revenue. Intergovernmental aid and shared revenues are not own-source revenues. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in the engineering department.
Information about expenditures for health and welfare.

Unassigned fund balance is the residual classification for the general fund. This classification represents fund balance that has not been assigned to other funds and that has not been restricted, committed, or assigned to specific purposes within the general fund. The general fund should be the only fund that reports a positive unassigned fund balance amount. In other governmental funds, if expenditures incurred for specific purposes exceeded the amounts restricted, committed, or assigned to those purposes, it may be necessary to report a negative unassigned fund balance [GASBS 54, ¶17].
Information about revenues from public safety.
Revenue from interest and rents that does not include interest and dividends, or rents and royalties.
Other revenues which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents lease contracts payable that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for education services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Collateral such as cash, securities, or letter of credit received as part of the securities lending transactions the government entity enters into. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Advances.
Fees charged to join or to extend an existing utility system. Often referred to as tap fees or system development fees.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Kindergarten through Eighth Grade, K‐8.
Information about other supplementary information.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Business.
Used to collect plan membership information about government pension or OPEB plans.
Information about local unit plans.
Information about expenses for insurance and claims.

Services provided by persons or businesses to assist in transmitting and receiving messages or information. This category includes telephone and voice communication services; data communication services to establish or maintain computer-based communications, networking, and Internet services; videocommunications services to establish or maintain one-way or two-way video communications via satellite, cable, or other devices; postal communications services to establish or maintain postage machine rentals, postage, express delivery services,and couriers. Includes licenses and fees for services such as subscriptions to research materials over the Internet. Expenditures for software should not be included.

Employer’s required contributions to the pension plan for the reporting period and separate liabilities to the pension plan that arise in the reporting period. This is the difference in net pension liability from the previous measurement date to the current measurement date. Pension expense includes the current period service cost, interest on the total pension liability, changes in benefit terms that are required to be recognized immediately, projected earnings on the pension plan investments and the current period’s recognition of deferred outflows and inflows.
Information about noncurrent liabilities payable from restricted assets.
Information about amounts paid to other governments.
Indicates if the local unit has a defined benefit plan. If yes, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Recovery of cost incurred. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for mental health.
Other nonoperating revenues or expenses.

Revenue earned from public safety services, generated by the police or sheriff department. Used in the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of government that have such an activity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Grant amounts for which asset recognition criteria have been met (such as cash that has been received, or amounts that are receivable), but for which it has not met the revenue recognition requirements. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Derivative instruments, a liability, reported on a current basis. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The balance of bonds payable due. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Liabilities and deferred inflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities associated with assisting the instructional staff with the content and process of providing learning experiences for students. These services pertain to the interaction between students and teachers, focusing on designing the curriculum training staff on training methods, assessing the student’s learning and retention of the subject matter and delivering and coordinating such activities.

Expenses incurred in the General Fund or separate Hospital Operating Fund of a county or a large city. Its use is mandatory by any such unit owning and operating a hospital. The Hospital Operating Fund will reflect all hospital expenses such as salaries and wages, patient’s services, lab and x-ray expenses, culinary department expenses, administrative expenses, and all other operating expenses of a general hospital.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Business.
Expenditures for sanitary sewer services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of special assessment debt with government commitment, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Number of active members who are employed at the end of the reporting or measurement period, as applicable.

Expenditures for health and welfare, mental health, used on the General Fund of Mental Health Fund. It reflects all expenditures of the mental health program, such as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, clinic expenditures, and all expenditures of the various sub-programs administered through this fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for health and welfare, hospital.

Other financing options, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Information about defined contribution plans.
Information about revenues from community and economic development.
Other restricted asset that have been set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Actual rate of return on OPEB assets, net of fees, for the previous five year period.

Special assessment taxes due to the government entity, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost of borrowing money during a specified period of time.
Full-time, part-time, and prorated portions of the costs for work performed by employees who are hired on a temporary or substitute basis. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about supplies.
All other capital assets, excluding land and improvements, buildings and equipment, vehicles, water and sewer system.
Expenses for other recreation and culture activities not including parks and recreation, library and various cultural activities, fine arts, historical society, museums, etc.
Expenses for insurance claims.
Aggregate of all employer contributions made for all defined contribution plans.
Restricted assets legally allocated to debt service reduced by liabilities and deferred inflows of resources related to those assets.
Information about expenditures for child care human services.
Information about amounts paid to state.
Net (Expense) Revenue for non instructional services.
Expenditures for garage services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Business.

Other restricted asset that have been set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.

Expenditures associated with community risk reduction, for example, fire safety education, fire cause determination, inspection of high hazard occupancies, and fire code enforcement, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Services supporting the instructional program and its administration Included are curriculum improvement services, counseling and guidance services, library and media support services, and contracted instructional services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of liabilities incurred to vendors for goods and services received, and accrued liabilities classified as other, payable within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues earned from the Abstract Department, used on the General Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The aggregate amount of revenues and expenses resulting from nonoperating activities (for example, interest and dividend revenue).
Revenue from sales tax which is imposed upon the sale or consumption of goods. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
All other current assets, excluding assets held for sale, prepaids, inventory, total receivables and cash and investments.
Amounts paid to state for corrections activities.
Amounts owed to the local government unit that are held by the Treasurer.
Information about defined benefits plans of the primary government.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of engineering equipment.
Assets set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues earned from installation services provided by the local government unit.

Expenditures for health and welfare, child care, family division of circuit court, used n the General Fund or the Child Care Fund. In the General Fund, it reflects the appropriation to the Child Care Fund and other childcare expenditures of the county not properly chargeable to the Child Care Fund. In the Child Care Fund, it reflects expenditures involving boarding and care of court wards, operating expenditures of a juvenile home, payments to the State for the care of juveniles at state institutions, and other expenditures properly payable from the Child Care Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with making nonpermanent improvements or enhancements to building sites. These improvements include fencing, walkways, tunnels and temporary landscaping.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Distributive/Marketing Education.
Discount rate used by the actuary to calculate the present value of all projected retiree health benefit payments.
Other financing uses.
Information about revenues from recreation and culture.
Information about infrastructure.
Indicates if the primary government has a defined benefit plan type of General Employees.
Expenditures for repairs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Penalty payments that are due but not yet paid. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about city income tax detail.

Revenue earned from an intermediate governmental jurisdiction for the benefit of the school district, including Colorado Division of Wildlife impact assistance grants. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about public works expenses.
Amount of debt payments related to the general obligation bonds, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for purchase of all supplies including freight and cartage for the delivery of these supplies, not including energy, food, books and periodicals.
Amount of income tax revenue from residents.

Amounts owed by a local unit of government to another local unit. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Enter the system's liabilities (actuarial accrued liabilities) as calculated using uniform assumptions reported at the valuation period ending date from the most recent actuarial valuation report for funding.
Information about expenditures for veterans programs.
Communication expense, for example telephone, cell phone, radios.
Amount of cost of acquisition or constructions of water mains and pipe connections.

Amounts of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about the pension plan.

Net (Expense) Revenue for outlays of governmental funds are not properly classified as expenditures, but still require budgetary or accounting control. These are classified as Other Uses. These include debt service payments (principal and interest) and certain transfers of moneys from one fund to another.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Distributive/Marketing Education.

Revenues from parks and recreation used on the General Fund or a Parks/Recreation Fund. It will reflect revenue earned by the parks or recreation department from other General Fund revenues. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A payment made to compensate a government for some or all of the property tax revenue lost due to tax exempt ownership or use of real property. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about total and all other local unit grants and contributions.
Revenues earned from utilities services provided by the local government unit.
Used to identify types of defined benefit plans.
Information about interfund accounts receivable.
Information about personnel statistics.
Information about water and sewer systems.

Expenditures for health and welfare, veterans' burials used on the General Fund. It reflects the statutory portion payable from the county’s General Fund toward the burial of a veteran who was a resident of the county. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for support service programs. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for storm sewer services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Intergovernmental balances payable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about health expenses.
Expenses associated with economic development services.
Amounts set aside to pay for debt service in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).

Expenditures for activities concerned with making nonpermanent improvements or enhancements to building sites. These improvements include fencing, walkways, tunnels and temporary landscaping. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of vested employee benefits that's due and payable within the normal operating cycle.

State grants used for local community stabilization effort. The Local Community Stabilization Authority Act, Act 86 of 2014, created the Local Community Stabilization Authority (LCSA) and made it responsible for distributing Local Community Stabilization Share (LCSS) revenue local units of government and schools throughout Michigan.
Program revenues associated with the station, buildings and equipment maintenance which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Cash and cash equivalents with trustee. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
Includes amounts paid to contractors for minor renovating and remodeling facilities.
Amounts paid by the school district to employees on leave, such as sabbatical leave, maternity leave, etc.
Amount of special assessments for which a roll has been prepared and confirmed, but which are not due. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required.
Other financing sources. Used to report amounts on a modified accrual basis.
Used to group information about the Proprietary Funds Statement of Net Position.
Proceeds from other sources not elsewhere classified.
Amount of bonds maturing in more than one year, and that are payable from restricted assets.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund, Municipal Street Fund, DPW Fund, or other similar funds of local units of government. Its use is mandatory for any unit employing an engineer or having an engineering department. It reflects such expenditures as salaries of the engineer and assistants, travel expenditures, engineer supplies, engineer equipment, and other supplies, or equipment essential to operation of the engineering office or department.

Expenses associated with recreation, parks and cultural services. Includes provision and support of recreational and cultural-scientific facilities and activities including golf courses, play fields, playgrounds, public beaches, swimming pools, tennis courts, parks, auditoriums, stadiums, auto camps, recreation piers, marinas, botanical gardens, galleries, museums, and zoos. Also includes building and operation of convention centers and exhibition halls.

Expenditures for district and municipal court, used in the General Fund of counties, certain cities, and certain townships which are designated by statute as control units of district courts. (A few cities still have municipal courts.) Mandatory for those units that have such a court. Incurs expenditures such as salaries, supplies and equipment necessary for court operation. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for community and economic development services.
All other grants, contributions and donations earned from local units.
Amounts reimbursed by the school district to any employee qualifying for tuition reimbursement based on school district policy.

Amount for lease assets for leases other than short-term leases and contracts that transfer ownership defined by GASB 87. At the commencement of the lease term, a lessee should recognize a lease liability and an intangible right-to-use lease asset a lessee initially should measure the lease asset as the sum of the following: 1) the amount of the initial measurement of the lease liability; 2) lease payments made to the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term, less any lease lease incentives received from the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term; 3) initial direct costs that are ancillary charges necessary to place the lease asset into service.
Loan guarantee liabilities, for example direct student loans.
Program revenues associated with vehicles and fire apparatus which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Amount of accumulation of periodic decreases in the estimated service life of land improvements due to wear and tear, deterioration, action of the physical elements, inadequacy, and obsolescence.
Noncurrent investments designated by the board.
Cash inflows from internal services provided.
Private contributions and donations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Works of art and historical treasures are collections or significant individual items that are owned by a government agency and held for public exhibition, education or research as part of a public service rather than for financial gain.
Transactions or other events that are both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence.

Expenditures for outlays of governmental funds are not properly classified as expenditures, but still require budgetary or accounting control. These are classified as Other Uses. These include debt service payments (principal and interest) and certain transfers of moneys from one fund to another. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

An acquisition of net assets applicable to changes in the employer’s proportion of the collective net OPEB liability since the prior measurement date, the net effect of that change on the employer's proportionate shares of the collective net OPEB liability and collective deferred outflows of resources and deferred inflows of resources related to OPEB, determined as of the beginning of the measurement period.
An acquisition of net assets related to taxes levied that applies to a future reporting period(s).
Net (expense) revenue associated with fund raisers.
Amounts due from the primary government that are not yet collected.
The right to use obtain the economic benefit from the use of an asset owned by another entity.
Expenses for economic development services.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund or in a Sanitary Landfill Fund of any local unit of government. Its use is mandatory by any local unit operating a sanitary landfill. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, bulldozing, equipment, and all other expenses applicable to the operation of a sanitary landfill.

Amounts paid to employees of the school district in either temporary or permanent positions for work performed in addition to the employee’s regular work assignment. Additional/extra duty pay/stipend includes compensation for such assignments as coaching, cocurricular activity sponsorship, supplemental pay for curriculum development, for night school, etc.
Revenue from other sources.
Total other revenues including reimbursements, sale of capital assets, public and private contributions, refunds and rebates and miscellaneous revenue.
Net (expense) revenue associated with pension contributions.

Expenditures for activities that are financed and operated for a manner similar to private business enterprises – where the stated intent is that the costs are financed or recovered primarily through user charges. Food Services should not be charged here but rather to program 3100. One example could be the school district bookstore or before‐ or after‐school day care programs Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash received from property tax collected that are not specifically restricted for capital purposes.
Expenses for sanitation.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for public safety purposes.
Receipts from capital grants awarded to the governmental enterprise.
Other assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Assets are resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
Contracted expenditures to reimburse other educational agencies for instructional services to students residing in the legal boundaries described for the paying school district.
Net (expense) revenue associated with special operations.

The amount of cash in the form of a separate bank account used only for making payments for personnel services and payroll deductions. Usually, a fixed sum is deposited to this bank account in an amount sufficient to meet the requirements of the bank for carrying the account without service charges, and the local unit for making payments for personnel services between regular pay periods. The principal use of this account is for the deposit of the amount of the gross payroll, against which individual payroll checks and/or direct deposits and payroll deduction checks and/or direct deposits will be drawn. Individual payroll checks and/or direct deposits drawn on this account between regular payroll periods will be included on the next regular payroll voucher. By this method, the fixed sum deposited in the payroll bank account will be replenished each pay period.
Pension actuarial valuation date.
Charges for services - all other fees, excluding parking facilities, all other services rendered charges, and all other sales, use and admission fees.
Expenses associated with harbor services.
Expenses associated with public ways and facilities services.

Current portion of accrued known and estimated losses incurred as of the balance sheet date for which no insurance coverage exists, and for which a claim has been made or is probable of being asserted, typically arising from workmen's compensation-type of incidents and personal injury to nonemployees from accidents on the entity's property.

Expenditures for activities associated with assisting the instructional staff with the content and process of providing learning experiences for students. These services pertain to the interaction between students and teachers, focusing on designing the curriculum training staff on training methods, assessing the student’s learning and retention of the subject matter and delivering and coordinating such activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Petty cash.
Amounts for which asset recognition criteria have been met (such as cash that has been received, or amounts that are receivable), but for which it has not met the revenue recognition requirements.
Net (expense) revenue associated with bad debt expense.
Total revenue for the entity.
Information about current and noncurrent restricted assets.
Information about sensitivity analysis.

Amounts of cash and investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage by donors. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.

A liability arising from payments not made to pension funds. This amount represents any difference between the actuarially determined annual required contribution and actual payments made to the pension fund.
Expenses associated with public schools services.
Interest and dividends received as returns on loans (except program loans), debt instruments of other entities, equity securities, and cash management or investment pools.
This account is provided for budgeting purposes only. Expenditures to be paid from the contingency should be charged to the appropriate program and object classification.

Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for all other purposes excluding general government, public safety, streets and highways, sanitation, health and hospitals, welfare, culture and recreation, housing and community development, water, electric or transit.

Expenses associated with the General Fund or in the Airport Fund of any local unit of government. It is for use by units to record all airport expenditures within this single activity. When used by a local unit, it will reflect all expenditures of an airport operation including administration, facilities, and equipment operation and maintenance, etc. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenue earned by the airport from other General Fund revenues.

Expenditures of a governing body (County Board of Commissioners, City Council, Township Trustee, Village Council) in the performance of its primary duties and subsidiary activities. Miscellaneous expenditures that the legislative body may authorize but that do not apply directly to the legislative body should not be charged to a legislative activity number (e.g., the cost of an indirect cost allocation plan).
Expenses for other public works services for enterprise activities.

Total pension liability (or, if an employer has a special funding situation, the employer’s proportionate share of the total pension liability) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point lower than the assumed discount rate.
Amounts paid to individuals who no longer are employed by the district. This includes early retirement incentive plan payments.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Kindergarten through Eighth Grade, K‐8. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Estimated noncurrent amounts due from third party payers, which are entities other than the patient or healthcare provider that reimburses and manages health care expenses.
Expenditures for all executive related expenditures within the unit of government, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Any construction work on, or improvement to, streets, roads, parking facilities, sidewalks, drainage structures and utilities or any other aspect of a site.
Information about pension plan deferred inflow of resources.
Net (expense) revenue associated with public safety services..
Property Tax (Includes Delinquent Taxes, Penalties, Interest, Fees, Community Wide Special Assessments), 401 - 449 excluding Account Numbers 424, 432, 429, 430, 433, 434, 435, 437, 438.
Initial payments made by the school district from leases which do not result in the acquisition of capital equipment or facilities.
Net (expense) revenue associated with amortization of debt issuance.
Penalty payments that are due but not yet paid.
Proceeds from interfund services provided, including payments in lieu of taxes that are payments for, and reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided.
Employer’s share of federally mandated insurance plans. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
This account is used to record debt payments related to the performance bonds that are due in future reporting periods.
Revenue from taxes from local sources other than those classified above. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue for health and welfare.
This account is used to record amounts of pension assets on deposit with a fiscal agent, OPEB funding, and deposits with bond trustees prior to payment.
Other expenses which can include capital outlay, debt service, depreciation or miscellaneous expenses not elsewhere categorized.
Information about total amounts on the Capital Assets Footnote.

Revenue internal to the district which is generated by charging user fees to other funds and programs for warehouse services. This code may be used only in an internal service fund or when internal service activities are involved.
Acquisition of OPEB related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until that time.
Information about pension plan deferred outflow of resources.
Amounts due to schools.
Net (expense) revenue for community and economic development services.
Used to represent information reported on the Capital Assets footnote.
Information about amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets.
Cash contributions and donations received for noncapital financing activities.
Revenue from tuition from school districts outside the state for instructional services provided. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue for other general government services and the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Amounts of noncurrent cash and investments that are formally reserved by the government unit, for a specific purpose.

Amount of the portion of tax anticipation notes or other notes to be paid by the local unit during the current year. A note payable is an unconditional written promise signed by the maker (authorized local unit officials) to pay a certain sum of money on demand or at a fixed or determinable time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Debit for payments made on such notes; credit for the number of notes to be paid during the current year.

Expenses incurred within the General Fund or a Sewer Fund of a local unit of government. Its use is mandatory for units having a sewage disposal system. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, maintenance costs, equipment, and all other expenses applicable to the operation of a sewage disposal system.
Unamortized premiums on investments.

Expenditures for health and welfare, hospital operation, used in the General Fund or Hospital Operating Fund. It reflects all hospital expenses such as salaries and wages, patient’s services, lab and x-ray expenses, culinary department expenses, administrative expenses, and all other operating expenses of a general hospital. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Represents name of a component unit, discretely presented.
Indicates the status of the pension plan which can be open or closed.
Net (expense) revenue associated with culture and recreation services.
Net (expense) revenue for drug case information management.
Information about capital assets not being depreciated, roll forward.
Assets owned by the local government unit but held by another government unit outside of the reporting entity.
Fees from other school districts outside the state for transporting students to and from school. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue for sanitation.
Federal operating grants and contributions provided for program revenues.
Information about sewer systems.
Measurement date for pension actuarial analysis.
State grants for drug case information management.
Amounts of liabilities incurred to vendors for goods and services received that are payable from restricted assets.
Capital assets, classified as not being depreciated. Land, for example is considered inexhaustible.
Amounts for specific revenues or gains that a local government unit defer to be recognized within the next reporting period.
Receipts from special assessments or property and other taxes levied specifically to finance the construction, acquisition, or improvement of capital assets.
Net (expense) revenue associated with ambulance.
Information about vehicles.

Expenses for parks facilities, used on the General Fund or on a Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects all expenditures by a local unit for the acquisition and operation of facilities to provide such recreation programs for its residents as golf, playgrounds, swimming, tennis, etc.
Payments to acquire equity and debt instruments for investment purposes.

The cost of construction or acquisition of a water system. This account may be pointed off to separate the various elements of a water system such as water lines, water mains, pumping plant, water treatment plant, etc.
Information about capital assets footnote, accumulated depreciation.
Expenditures for mental health and state institutions, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Earnings on investments not classified elsewhere. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Capital grants and contributions from federal government for program revenues.
Profit earned from arbitrage that must be paid back (or rebated) to the federal government
Net (expense) revenue associated with economic development services.
Net (expense) revenue court from reimbursement of guardian ad litem services.
Resources received from others.

Represent lease contracts payable in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.

Amount of the balance of special assessments remaining unpaid on and after the date on which a penalty is effective. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required.

Total pension liability (or, if an employer has a special funding situation, the employer’s proportionate share of the total pension liability) calculated using a discount rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed discount rate.
Other deferred inflows of resources.
Other salaries.
Proceeds from bond issuances.
Revenues from other Food Services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Obligations for landfill post-closure care costs that are due and payable in future reporting periods.
Net (expense) revenue associated with harbor services.

Expenditures for child care, family division of circuit court, and child care department of human services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

State grants for land surveying activities performed by a surveyor to perpetuate a previously monumented original public land survey corner, protracted public land survey corner, or property controlling corner.
The accumulation of systematic and rational allocations of the estimated cost of using assets, on a historical basis, over the useful life of the assets.
Estimated amounts due to third party payers in more than one year which are entities other than the patient or healthcare provider that reimburses and manages health care expenses.
Information about buildings and equipment.
Expenses for landscaping and maintenance.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of all vehicles and equipment that are required to have a license plate such as cars, trucks, etc.
Proceeds from reimbursements or refunds from insurance companies, also known as stop loss funds.
Amounts due from cities.
Net (expense) revenue associated with airport services.
State operating grants and contributions provided for program revenues.
State and local monies awarded under state and local programs.

Expenditures for the operation of a local food service facility by other than employees of the school district. Included are contracted services for administrative and management fees, labor and indirect costs being charged by food service companies.
Information about the sum of capital assets being depreciated, and not being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Revenue earned from pupil organization membership dues. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Obligations scheduled to mature beyond one year from the date of a government’s financial statements not elsewhere classified and payable from restricted assets.
Indicates the pension plan type which can be single or agent multi-employer or cost-sharing employer.
Capital grants and contributions from local units for program revenues.

Expenditures for zoning used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries or per diem of board members, travel expenditures, zoning board of appeals expenditures, supplies, and other expenditures involved in the zoning of local unit property as residential, commercial, and industrial. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue court filing fees.

Short-term amounts due from enterprise funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
Expenses for snow removal.

The amount after accumulated depreciation and amortization of physical assets such as land, improvements to land, easements, buildings, building improvements, vehicles, machinery, equipment, works of art and historical treasures, infrastructure, construction in progress, and all other tangible or intangible assets that have been, or will be, used in operations and that have initial useful lives extending beyond a single reporting period. Infrastructure assets are long-lived capital assets that normally are stationary in nature and can be preserved for a significantly greater number of years than most capital assets.
Amounts paid by the school district for health, dental, vision, and cancer insurance coverage for its employees.
Information about changes in pension liabilities.
An acquisition of net assets related to pension and OPEB that applies to a future reporting period(s).
Revenue earned from estate inventory fee.
The cost method used in the actuarial valuation of the pension.
Net (expense) revenue court from statute costs.
Revenues from community organizations or agencies for day care centers. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other financing uses. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for sanitation purposes.

Program revenues used for Public Works Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The Department of Public Works-Facilities (Facilities) provides crucial services that improve the quality of life for the residents and ensures infrastructure and assets are safe and reliable.

Expenditures for auditorium and/or civic center, used on the General Fund or in a Civic Auditorium Fund. In the General Fund, it may reflect all civic center/auditorium expenditures. In the Civic Auditorium Fund, it will reflect such expenditures as salaries and wages of civic center or auditorium personnel, travel expenditures, supplies and all other expenditures necessary to provide civic center or auditorium services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of a water system.
Amounts of cash and investments that are formally reserved by the government unit, for a specific purpose.

Services supporting the professional and technical development of school district personnel, including instructional, administrative, and service employees. Included are course registration fees (that are not tuition reimbursement), charges from external vendors to conduct training courses (at either school district facilities or off-site), and other expenditures associated with training or professional development by third-party vendors. All expenditures should be captured in this account regardless of the type or intent of the training course or professional development activity.
Information about capital assets costs before reducing for accumulated depreciation.
Receipts from contributions made by other funds for the specific purpose of defraying the cost of acquiring, constructing, or improving capital assets.
Information about changes in fiduciary net position.

Extraordinary items which are transactions or other events that are both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence combined with special items which are significant transactions or other events within the control management that are either unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of licensed vehicles and equipment.
Amounts restricted for bonds and interest redemption.
Inventory for internal use.
Operating grants and contributions from local units provided for program revenues.
Expenses associated with public works services.

Net (Expense) Revenue from non-business licenses and permits and franchise fees. License and permit fees exacted (either for revenue raising or for regulation) as a condition to the exercise of a non-business privilege. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from probation oversight fee.
Indicates if the plan is Defined Benefit or Defined Contribution.
Capital assets being depreciated, costs before reducing for accumulated depreciation.
Revenue for services provided by the district or BOCES to another governmental or nongovernmental unit. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from townships for most purposes, except for county road commissions or township road agreements.
Information about changes in net pension liability (asset).
Expenses for public works that qualify as Non-Act 51.
Amounts held by the entity for others to be returned in future periods.
Information about total capital assets at historical assets, which includes capital assets being depreciated and capital assets not being depreciated.

Expenditures for Watershed Council for any local unit supporting a watershed project, and is used on the General Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with public assistance services.
Contributions from local government units for streets and highways.
Accrued interest. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Fees and commissions paid to third parties in connection with the issuance of debt.
Used to represent information reported on the Statement of Net Position on Form F65.
Capital grants and contributions from state government for program revenues.
Pension assumed salary growth rate.
Cash proceeds from matured securities.
Information about pension plans.
Revenue for drunk driving case flow assistance.
Capital assets at historical cost which is the aggregate of capital assets being depreciated, gross, and capital assets, not being depreciated.

Technology-related supplies include supplies that are typically used in conjunction with technology-related hardware or software. Some examples are CDs,flash or jump drives, parallel cables, and monitor stands. Software costs below the capitalization threshold should be reported here.
Cash payments to employees for services.
Revenue from rents and royalties. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The number of pension plan terminated employees entitled to benefits but not yet receiving benefits.
Amounts set aside to retire debt(s) in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).
Amount of payments related to contracts that are due and payable within the normal operating cycle.
Net change in pension liability.
Cash received from governmental agencies and nongovernmental parties that are for specific projects.
Amounts due from the state government in more than one year. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.
Used to collect information found on a Statement of Position.
Information about capital assets being depreciated, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.

Expenditures from current funds for all judgments against the school district that are not covered by liability insurance, but are of a type that might have been covered by insurance. Only amounts paid as the result of court decisions are recorded here. This would include student transportation liability claims incurred and paid by the school district. Judgments against the school district resulting from failure to pay bills or debt service are recorded under the appropriate expenditure accounts as though the bills or debt service had been paid when due. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Inflation-related changes to benefit payments promised to retirees.
Program revenues used for state health benefit, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Additions to capital assets at historical cost.
Amount of advances to other units of government where such advances are not due within a year. An example is an advance to a building authority.

Used in the General Fund of all local units of government. Its use is mandatory. It reflects expenditures such as salaries, travel, office supplies, equipment, etc., necessary for office operation. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenue earned by the clerk’s office from other General Fund revenue. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Object codes in this series allow a district to charge costs associated with student field trips, maintenance, and other internal services to the programs which benefit from the services.
Information about assets and deferred outflows.
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to service costs.
Amount of debt payments related to the revenue bonds that are due in future reporting periods.
Capital assets, classified as depreciable, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Net (expense) revenue associated with public works services.

This account is used to record amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Information about cash and cash equivalents and investments.
The number of pension plan DROP (Deferred Retirement Option Plan) participants receiving benefits into their DROP accounts.
Initial payments made by the school district from leases which do not result in the acquisition of capital equipment or facilities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

The cost of long-term investments of surplus funds under 1943 PA 20 (for the government’s assets) and 1965 PA 314 (for pension and OPEB trust fund assets). This includes government bonds, treasury bills, treasury notes, municipal bonds, stocks, mortgages, land purchased for investment purposes, etc. A long-term investment is an investment having a maturity date of more than one year from the date of purchase.
Program revenues used for other development services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Used to collect information found on a Capital Assets footnote.
Accreted interest is interest accrued on a loan asset that is added to the principal rather than being paid as interest while it accrues.
Payments made to other funds for the specific purpose of defraying the cost of acquiring, constructing, or improving capital assets.
Amount of accumulation of periodic decreases in the estimated life of machinery and equipment.

Funds that a district must send to the Division of Vocational Rehabilitation (DVR) This payment supports the DVR request for federal government grant award dollars that will be provided to the district School to Work Alliance Program (SWAP) is the grant program with this type of arrangement.
Deposits held by the trustee to be used for debt service.
The single rate of return that, when applied to all projected benefit payments, results in an actuarial present value of projected benefit payments.
Net (expense) revenue court from probation oversight fee.

Cost of land purchased by the local unit. Land acquired by gift or grant should be recorded at acquisition value. Road commissions also use this account to record the acquisition cost of land for road purposes. The cost of land includes legal fees, land surface leveling, debris removal, and other costs necessary to place the land in service.
Information about cash and cash equivalents.
Program revenues used for convention center services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Other deferred inflows of resources, which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Changes in Net Pension Liability due to interest on the total pension liability.
State grants used for crime victims rights.
Cash flows from investing activities. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Information about Cash.

Expenses for parks supervision, used on the General Fund or on a Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, materials, and equipment necessary to supervise park operation or recreation programs of a local unit.
Program revenues used for water supply services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Short-term amounts due from a retirement system fund within the local government's reporting entity. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
Revenue internal to the district which is generated by charging user fees to other funds and programs for other internal service activity.
Contributions to a pension plan’s fiduciary net position for amounts from nonemployer contributing entities, such as a state government contributing to local government pension plans.
Additions to capital assets that are not being depreciated and not being amortized.

Amount of increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents are the amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near maturity that the investments present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Includes effect from exchange rate changes.
Pension plan contribution rate as a percentage of payroll.
Information about cash in the bank.
Other financing options, current.
Cash payments to other suppliers for other goods or services.
Revenue earned from jury demand fees.

Additions to accumulated depreciation which is the accumulation of systematic and rational allocations of the estimated cost of using assets, on a historical basis, over the useful life of the assets.
The number of pension plan disabled participants currently receiving benefits.
Revenue earned from Provider Relief Funds and other COVID 19 funding.
Sewage system.

Currency, coins, checks, money orders, and bankers' drafts on hand or on deposit with an official or agent designated as custodian of cash or demand deposits with financial institutions. Cash equivalents are short-term highly liquid investments including Treasury bills, commercial paper, and money market funds. Use PeriodEnd or PeriodStart labels to represent end of period or start of period balance.
Amounts paid by the school district for employee assistance program benefits which are not classified above Often these are included as gross income on W-2's (eg, auto allowance).
Additions to compensated absences payable.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Special Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Social Sciences. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from property tax administration fees which are defined as fees to offset costs incurred by a collecting unit in assessing property values, in collecting the property tax levies, and in the review and appeal processes.

Other assets that the local government unit does not separately disclose. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Allowance for penalties receivable.
Revenue earned from COVID 19 grants.
Intangible assets.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Technical Education/Computer Technology. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cumulative total balance of all patient charges due, owed and outstanding. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue court from building inspection fees.
Reductions from claims and judgments payable.
Funding to component units, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from fees at recreation sites which can include money paid for participating in or observing sporting, athletic, sightseeing, or recreational activities. Not associated with a specific program.
Net (expense) revenue for operations.
Allowance for claims and judgments receivable.
Expenditures for assessing equalization, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about medicaid Upper Payment Limit (UPL) receivable.
Computer software.
Revenue earned from payment protection program revenue.

Other liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Reductions from loans payable.

Adjustments for transfer of revenues within activities which includes a) significant transactions or other events within the control of management that are either unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence are special items. Special items should also be reported separately in the statement of activities, before extraordinary items, if any. In addition, governments should disclose in the notes to financial statements any significant transactions or other events that are either unusual or infrequent but not within the control of management, b) extraordinary items that are transactions or other events that are both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence. Extraordinary items should be reported separately at the bottom of the statement of activities, c) contribution to permanent fund are amounts remitted to funds whose principal balances may not be legally expended.
Net (expense) revenue for fire fighting.
Net (expense) revenue associated with public schools services.
Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits.
Allowance for government claims receivable.

Expenditures for parks maintenance, used on the General Fund or a Park/Recreation Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages of custodians, maintenance supplies, maintenance equipment, and all other expenses necessary to properly maintain parks or recreation facilities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
dup_1_Cumulative total balance of medicaid (UPL) payments due, owed and outstanding.
Land and improvements.

An acquisition of net assets related to property tax collection that applies to a future reporting period(s). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from net pension liability.
An unconditional transfer of cash or other assets to the local government unit.
Other adjustments for transfer of revenues within activities. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Amounts payable as refunds.
Revenue earned from ambulance transport fees.
The portion of tuition and fees receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Revenue earned from probation oversight fee. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue for fire prevention.
Land improvements.

Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is legally restricted as to the purposes for which it may be used. Often a fund’s entire fund balance will be restricted, but sometimes, such as in the General Fund, only a portion will be restricted. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Information about revenue for recreation, culture and conservation.

Program revenues used for Public Ways and Facilities, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Facilities is responsible for maintaining county owned roads, bridges, buildings, vehicles, and equipment; managing landfill, recycling, and litter control operations; and providing snow removal or emergency response services for severe weather-related road conditions. Facilities also provides educational and outreach opportunities for residents to learn about services and programs.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Athletic/Sport. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Reductions from Net OPEB Liability. An employer's net OPEB obligation is defined as the cumulative difference between annual OPEB cost and the employer's contributions to a plan, including the OPEB liability or asset at transition, if any. Use this concept when there is an OPEB liability.

Revenue earned from city usage of utilities tax which is levied in proportion to gross receipts on public or privately owned public utilities that provide electric, gas, water and/or telephone service.

Amount of monies on deposit in savings accounts under the control of the official or agent designated as custodian. This account is debited when money is deposited in a savings account; credited when money is withdrawn from a savings account.

A sum of money either in the form of currency, a special bank deposit, or a separate bank account set aside for the purpose of making change or paying incidental expenses. It is used for expenses that, for practical reasons, cannot be paid in the regular manner. At certain intervals, the petty cash is replenished by a check drawn on the fund from which the petty cash expenses are payable. An itemized voucher for the amount of disbursements made from petty cash must support the replenishment check. The total of petty cash on hand and/or on deposit, plus un-replenished disbursements, must always equal the imprest cash account balance.
Allowance for inter governmental receivable.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue for training.
Used to identify types of capital assets.
Information about Insurance Settlement Receivable.
Revenue from refunds and rebates. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from intergovernmental agreement payable.
The portion of interest receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Expenses associated with building authority.
Net (expense) revenue for emergency services.
Land and Construction in Progress.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received on special assessments, amount net of allowance for uncollectible amount. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable on special assessments. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due of insurance settlements. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from pollution remediation obligations.
Allowance for amounts for medical billings receivable.
The portion of personal property taxes levied which have become due but have not become delinquent.
Net (expense) revenue for dispatch.
Timber properties.
Delinquent special assessments due within one year but not yet collected as of the balance sheet date. Amounts are net of uncollectible. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from asset retirement obligations.
Net (expense) revenue court from ambulance transport fees.

Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for all other purposes excluding general government, public safety, streets and highways, sanitation, health and hospitals, welfare, culture and recreation, housing and community development, water, electric or transit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for emergency medical services receivable.
Revenue earned from title search fees.
The portion of property taxes receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Net (Expense) Revenue for the reimbursement of costs associated with special elections.
The amount of currency, checks, money orders, and bank drafts on hand or on deposit with an official or agent designated as custodian of cash and bank deposits (local unit treasurer).
Used to identify types of capital assets.

Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Nonathletic. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Program revenues used for fire marshal, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Special assessment liens receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from unamortized premium on bonds.

Amounts of cash and cash equivalents that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
State grants for culture and recreation purposes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from motor fuel tax which are taxes levied on gasoline, diesel, and gasohol (a mixture of ethanol and unleaded gasoline).

Short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near maturity that the investments present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less meet the definition.
Expenses associated with fire marshal.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of tax liens receivable earned but not received, amount net of allowance for uncollectible amount. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from leases.
Construction in Progress.
Amount of uncollected portion of special assessments a government unit has levied. It represents the amount due within one year and not yet considered delinquent.
Revenue from reimbursements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of vehicles that have been customized for use during firefighting operations, as well as ambulances and other vehicles.
Program revenues used for fire fighting, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
The amount of personal property taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date becoming delinquent. A detailed account must be maintained for each year's levy.
Amount of accrued interest and penalties on taxes receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Contributions from local government units for housing and community development. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from local sources. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Meters.
Revenue earned from lottery proceeds.
The amount of nonnegotiable (redemption terms that do not consider market rates) certificates of deposit held by the local unit treasurer.
Reductions from bond premiums.
Program revenues used for fire prevention, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Amounts due related to operating leases and rental agreements. Amount is net of allowance for uncollectible amount. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Leasehold improvements.

Program revenues used for Public Assistance Services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Public assistance refers to assistance programs that provide either cash assistance or in-kind benefits to individuals and families from any governmental entity. There are two major types of public assistance programs; social welfare programs and social insurance programs.

Amounts from due from the federal government not yet collected. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.
Allowance for patient accounts receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from Installment Debt.

Revenue from charges for services and sales. Charges for services includes charges to customers, applicants, or others who purchase, use, or directly benefit from the goods, services, or privileges provided, or are otherwise directly affected by the services. Includes revenue from fees charged for specific services, such as water use or garbage collection; licenses and permits, such as dog licenses, liquor licenses, and building permits; operating special assessments, such as for street cleaning or special street lighting; and any other amounts charged to service recipients. Fines and forfeitures are also included in this category. Should also include payments from other governments for goods or services—for example, when County A reimburses County B for boarding County A prisoners. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Program revenues used for training and education, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Current amount due to the local unit on Interfund loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from grants and entitlement programs not restricted for specific programs.
Shop equipment.
Represents other cash and cash equivalents held with others.
dup_1_Allowance for medicaid (UPL) receivable.
Reductions from compensated absences payable.
Benefits payable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with telecommunications, for example telephone, cell phone, radios.
Program revenues used for emergency medical services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Revenue from interest, dividends, rents, investment gains (losses) and royalties. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from corporate tax which is a tax on the profits of a corporation. The taxes are paid on a company's taxable income, which includes revenue minus cost of goods sold (COGS), general and administrative (G&A) expenses, selling and marketing, research and development, depreciation, and other operating costs.

Short-term amounts due from a custodial fund within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
Amounts reported for deferred inflows that are tied to leases. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Waterworks system.

Cash balances of substantially all funds are pooled and invested by the entity's Treasurer for the purpose of increasing interest earnings through investment activities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about capital contributions and transfers.
Net (expense) revenue court from title search fees.
Program revenues used for dispatch, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Patents.
Grants, contributions and donations earned from other sources which can include nonprofit organizations and for-profit businesses that provide grants or other types of funding assistance.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to investments in lottery prizes.

Amount of nonnegotiable (redemption terms that do not consider market rates) certificates of deposit held by the local government unit treasurer or financial institution that are set aside to satisfy contractual or regulatory requirements.
Allowance for insurance settlements receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Inventory held for resale.

Expenditures for probation, used on the General Fund of a county or a city. Its use is mandatory for units having a probation officer (Department). Reflects expenditures for the operation of the probation office or department. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net pension liability, principal due within one year.
Revenue earned from usage of utilities tax which is levied in proportion to gross receipts on public or privately owned public utilities that provide electric, gas, water and/or telephone service.
Expenses associated with fire fighting.
Land.

Cash and cash equivalents with fiscal and escrow and other agents. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty.
Information about special assessment taxes receivable, current.

Net OPEB Liability, principal due within one year. An employer's net OPEB obligation is defined as the cumulative difference between annual OPEB cost and the employer's contributions to a plan, including the OPEB liability or asset at transition, if any. Use this concept when there is an OPEB liability.
Expenses associated with fire fighting.
Vehicles.
Public and private contributions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

The cost of short-term investments in government bonds, treasury bills, treasury notes, and money market certificates, and negotiable certificates of deposit. A negotiable certificate of deposit is a form of a participating interest-earning investment contract whose value generally is affected by market (interest rate) changes. A short-term investment is an investment having a maturity date of 1 year or less.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to dues and fees.
Expenditures for public works, Non Act 51. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from convention tax levied for convention and trade center services which the consumer pays for lodging on stays less than 30 days at lodging businesses.
Amount of reimbursements or refunds from insurance companies, also known as stop loss funds.
Other assets that the local government unit does not separately disclose. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cost of stockpiled supplies inventory.
Information about noncurrent liabilities.
Expenses associated with training.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to directors fees.
Amounts for medical billings receivable., net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.
Utility.
Securities that are set aside to satisfy contractual or regulatory requirements.
Aggregate amount of long term debt, both current and noncurrent.
Expenses associated with emergency medical services.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to trustees fees.

Expenditures for various public works of a local unit. These include the public works department, drain expense, roads and streets, street lighting, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Proceeds from bond and/or note issuance including premiums on bonds or notes, and bond or insurance recoveries.
Amounts for emergency medical services receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.
Improvements, other than building.

Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source and which are restricted as to use, and net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
