Revenue earned from sales and use tax levied which is defined as a tax on the storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item or service on which no sales tax has been paid. Use tax is a complementary or compensating tax to the sales tax and does not apply if the sales tax was charged.
Expenses associated with dispatch.
Additions to long term debt, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to management fees.
Cash balances of substantially all funds are pooled and invested by the entity's Treasurer for the purpose of increasing interest earnings through investment activities.
Accrued tuition and fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Operating revenue from lease interest income.

Amounts of cash and pooled investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
Engineering equipment.

Amounts due from the federal government in more than one year. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.

Expenditures for fire department, fire fighting. Used on the General Fund or Fire Fund of local units of government that have such an activity. It reflects expenditures such as salaries, travel, office expenses, uniforms, firefighting supplies, and other supplies, and maintenance necessary to provide fire department services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to landscaping and maintenance.

Used in the General Fund of local units of government. Its use is mandatory for units having a purchasing department or officer. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., necessary for the purchasing operation. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Proceeds received from bond issues to finance primary and local road construction and improvements in special assessment districts, and advances or prepayments received from individuals and local units in these districts to finance this work. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis for amounts due in more than one year.
Timber rights.

Amount of advances to the primary government from other funds or component units within the same reporting entity. Debit for amounts advanced to primary governments; credit for the repayments of any portion of such advances.
Used to report information found on the Governmental Funds Balance Sheet.
Expenses associated with retention and recruitment activities.
Cumulative total balance of all patient charges due, owed and outstanding. Amount reported net of allowance for uncollectible amount. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Grants, contributions and donations earned from other sources which can include nonprofit organizations and for-profit businesses that provide grants or other types of funding assistance.

Other liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to snow removal.
Allowance for accounts receivable, noncurrent.
Name of unearned revenue which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Revenue earned from unclaimed property which can be lost or forgotten assets from dormant bank accounts, uncashed checks, valuables left in safe deposit boxes and stock certificates.
Furniture and fixtures.

Expenses associated with special operations which is for tasks other than standard firefighting operations. Special operations may include water rescue, extrication, hazardous materials, and other operations requiring specialized training.
dup_1_Cumulative total balance of medicaid (UPL) charges due, owed and outstanding. Amount reported net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
Reductions from long term debt, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Net (Expense) Revenue for expenses related to insurance expense.
Investments held by third parties.
Used to represent information in a table on the Governmental Funds Balance Sheet.
Allowance for grants and contracts receivable, noncurrent.

Revenue earned from sales and use tax levied on selective items such as motor fuel, tobacco products or alcoholic beverages. Sales and use is defined as a tax on the storage, use, or consumption of a taxable item or service on which no sales tax has been paid. Use tax is a complementary or compensating tax to the sales tax and does not apply if the sales tax was charged.
Name of other expenses which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Deferred inflows of resources, special assessments. Deferred inflows represents an acquisition of net position by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with buildings, stations and equipment maintenance.

Investments with state treasury, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.
Revenue earned from pro forfeiture mailing notice cost.
Yard and storage equipment.
Pollution remediation obligations, principal due within one year.

These expenses may be found in the General Fund or a corresponding Enterprise Fund or Internal Service Fund. Its use is mandatory in the Internal Service Fund and Enterprise Fund. Its use is optional in the General Fund. It may be used to reflect both expenses and revenues in the operation of the information technology department.
Expenses associated with conferences and workshops.

Used to represent funds categorized as Special Revenue, Capital Project, Debt Service, Permanent, or Other. Use with the FundType element to indicate the fund type, and use the element FundName to specify the government-specific fund name, for example "Public Education" or "Transportation".
Allowance for leases receivable, noncurrent.
Expenses associated with vehicles and fire apparatus.
Revenue used for the reimbursement of costs associated with special elections.
Revenue earned from estate inventory fee. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts of cash and investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
Carrying amount, net of allowances for uncollectible amounts, as of the balance sheet date of amounts due of insurance settlements. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Record amounts that represent a discrepancy between a company's reported figures (from its sales records or receipts) and its audited figures.
Trademarks.

Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is not in spendable form (that is, the portion that results from assets that are not spendable - prepaids, inventory, long-term advances to other funds, or other receivables whose collection is not likely in the next year). Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Information on the Governmental Funds Balance Sheet.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local unit from any source, net of uncollectible amounts.
Allowance for notes and loans receivable, noncurrent.

Expenses for the initial and replacement items of equipment, such as machinery, furniture, fixtures, and vehicles. Machinery, furniture, and fixtures (including teacher desks, chairs, and file cabinets), technology equipment, and other equipment that are used for instructional purposes should be charged to appropriate instructional programs. The district’s capital asset policy establishes criteria for when an equipment item must be capitalized and included on the district’s property inventory records Usually this criteria requires equipment costing above a certain dollar amount to be capitalized..

Expenditures for marine law enforcement, used on the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of governments. It reflects all expenditures such as salaries, travel supplies, equipment, etc., incidental to the marine safety program. The State reimburses some of the expenditures charged to this activity; such reimbursement should be recorded as well.
Parking decks and lots.
Costs incurred for space renting to support the local government unit's operation.

A financial interest in a joint venture evidenced by the ownership of shares of the joint venture’s stock or by otherwise having an explicit, measurable right to the net resources of the joint venture that is usually based on an investment of financial or capital resources by a participating government.

Revenue earned from sales tax which is imposed by the government on the sale of goods and services. A conventional sales tax is levied at the point of sale, collected by the retailer, and passed on to the government.
Used as an identifier for other activities.
Computer equipment.
Information about Inter Governmental Receivables due in less than one year.
Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of accounts and financing receivables, classified as current. Includes, but is not limited to, notes and loan receivable.
Investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage.

Amount for which asset recognition criteria have been met, but the amount has not yet been earned. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Amounts received or held by the local unit as a result of the garnishment of wages. These amounts are subsequently paid to parties specified in the garnishment order.
Amounts collected for or otherwise due to individuals who are wards of the court.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Technical Education/Computer Technology.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Special Education.
Revenues from a variety of sources for pupil activities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to enterprise funds within the same reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenues from community organizations or agencies for adult education programs. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash received from quality assurance supplement program.
Expenditures associated with facilities maintenance, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash overdraft. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about allowances.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Technical Education/Computer Technology.
Allowance for notes receivable due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts owed to the local government unit that are held by the Treasurer, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.
Restricted net position for nutrition services.
Restricted for TABOR Multi Year Obligations.
Name of other lottery cost which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Revenue for the use of district‐owned facilities and equipment by non‐district parties. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts paid for goods or services not properly classified in one of the objects included above Payments for refunds of prior year revenues are charged to this account. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Accrued Liabilities.
Federal capital grants. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash payments made for quality assurance provider tax program.
Allowance for inter governmental receivable, due in more than one year, estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue in the form of gifts or donations from private sources. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other salaries. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Athletic/Sport.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Technical Education/Computer Technology.
Personal money being held for patients or inmates while lodged in a local unit facility (medical care facility, hospital, jail, etc.).

Revenue from health and welfare, Department of Human Services, used on the General Fund or the Social Welfare Fund. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenues of the Social Welfare Fund from other county revenues. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents all court related revenues within a local unit of government. Organization units may include trial court, circuit court, district court, and friend of the court. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of the local government unit's liability for payroll taxes incurred but not due until a later date. Debit upon payment or reversing the entry; credit monthly or at the end of the fiscal year for amounts of accrued taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other deferred outflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash payments for lottery prizes.
Information about Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities.
Expenditures for the medical examination, treatment, and care of sick or injured firefighters, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Nonathletic.
Information about special assessments.
Allowances for chargebacks.
Information about accrued wages and related liabilities.
Name of payable from restricted assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Payments made by the State to PERA on behalf of school districts, BOCES and charter schools. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for school district, service or commodity.
Cash receipts for ticket sales.
Plant owned by a utility entity used in the operations of the entity.

Compensated absences payable are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts received by the local unit, usually in accordance with court orders, which are to be subsequently paid to injured parties as restitution as directed by the court orders.
Information about compensated absences payable.
Information about Funds Balances Restricted.
Cash payments to lottery retailers.
Amount of the cost of construction or acquisition of water and sewer systems.
Information about other expenditures for school district, service or commodity, salaries.

Expenditures for activities concerned with acquiring land and buildings; remodeling buildings; constructing buildings and additions to buildings; initially installing or extending service systems and other built‐in equipment; and improving sites. Minor remodeling which does not change the capital assets of the building should be charged to program 2600 series. However, major remodeling should be charged to program 4000 series. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
State preschool program. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about amounts due to other funds.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Special Education.
Fund Balance, restricted for excise tax revenue.
Cash provision for returned lottery tickets.
Revenues earned from interest and penalties on special assessments.
Amount of accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of assets held under a lease arrangements.
Information about school district, other uses of funds.
Information about Funds Balances Committed.

Amounts collected for and owed to the fiduciary funds within the same reporting entity. Debit for all payments to the fiduciary fund; credit for all amounts owed to the fiduciary fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about intergovernmental revenue.
Cash provision for free lottery ticket redemptions.

This account is normally used in an Enterprise Fund to record the liability created when a customer is required to pay a deposit before receiving services. This is also used to record the liability for interest on customers’ deposits in those cases where an enterprise or utility has agreed to pay interest on such deposits.
The portion of interest receivable on special assessments estimated not to be collectible. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Special Education.
Tax, utility and assessment receivables.
Outlays from current funds to retire serial bonds and long-term loans. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about noncurrent liabilities.
Expenditures for convention center services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Bond principal. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of delinquent special assessments receivable estimated not to be collectible. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for convention center services.
Name of other fund balance restricted which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Grants, contributions and donations earned from federal governmental entities which are used to help finance a broad range of services, including health care, education, social services, infrastructure, and public safety.
An acquisition of net assets related to taxes levied that applies to a future reporting period(s). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts paid for scholarships awarded to students to pursue post-secondary educational opportunities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of special assessment liens receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Services purchased to operate, repair, maintain, and rent property owned or used by the government. These services are performed by persons other than government employees. While a product may or may not result from the transaction, the primary reason for the purchase is the service provided. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about revenue earned from investment income and rentals.
Information about interest receivable, special assessments.
Interest receivable on investments, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts to be returned to persons or firms which overpaid taxes.

Amounts paid for services rendered by organizations or personnel not on the payroll of the government (separate from Professional and Technical Services or Property Services). While a product may or may not result from the transaction, the primary reason for the purchase is the service provided. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Delinquent taxes receivable, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
A consumption of OPEB related net assets due to contributions to the OPEB plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date.
All other accounts payable and current liabilities, excluding due to other funds, accrued wages and benefits.
Allowance for amounts for medical billings receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for facilities acquisition and construction activities which cannot be classified above. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Earnings on investments in real property. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Athletic/Sport.
The portion of tax liens receivable estimated not to be collectible. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from interest and dividends.
Allowance for amounts for ambulance services receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenues from health and welfare, agency on aging, used on the General Fund. It reflects revenues from operating any senior citizen program. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from federal leases which are distributed per state statute by the county commissioners. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other restricted assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Amounts paid for items that are consumed, worn out, or deteriorated through use; or items that lose their identity through fabrication or incorporation into different or more complex units or substances. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expense for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students.
Revenue earned from dividends.

Expenditures for activities, other than general administration, which support each of the other instructional and supporting services programs. These activities include planning, research, development, evaluation, information, staff, data processing and risk management services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Athletic/Sport.
The portion of rent receivable estimated not to be collectible. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for amounts for fire protection services accounts receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received on special assessments. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable on special assessments. Reported on a modieifed accrual basis.

Revenue from taxes collected during the current fiscal year which were due and payable during a previous fiscal or tax year and related penalties and interest. Negative amounts are allowed and reported as reductions of revenues, not expenditures. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts owed by a local unit to the State where such amounts are due in years subsequent to the current fiscal year. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases.
Increase (decrease) in accrued insurance claims.
Allowance for Interfund loans receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about special assessment receivables, delinquent.
Allowance for emergency medical services receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The capital outlay related to the acquisition of a lease under GASB Statement No. 88. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for Health Department used on the General Fund or Health Department Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries and wages of health department personnel, supplies, clinic expenditures, lab expenditures, and other expenditures applicable to a health department. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Integrated Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Subject matter and/or activities, usually not provided in regular classes, designed for pupils who wish to pursue satisfying individual/group interests in areas such as academics, music, and school/public service. Frequently, these activities provide opportunities for students to acquire specialized knowledge and to develop social, citizenship, and leadership skills. These activities usually are planned for enriching the regular classes and lives of pupils.
Amount of special assessment debt with government commitment due in less than one year.
Information about investment income.
Allowance for interest and penalties receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about special assessment liens receivable.
Expenditures for project costs, not capital outlay. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for endowments.

Family Self-Sufficiency (FSS) is an employment-focused program available to individuals and families receiving Housing Choice Voucher or Public Housing assistance through Housing Connect. The FSS program directs an amount based on the rent increase to an interest-bearing escrow account maintained by a Public Housing Authority that is disbursed to participants that reach key employment and self-sufficiency milestones.
Information about changes in OPEB liabilities.
Revenue from State sources that the State Department of Education sends to Districts and Board of Cooperative Educational Services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about revenue earned from rents and royalties.
Special assessment liens receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned or lost through investments.

Transfers which are inflows of assets to a fund. A transfer is a flow of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment. This category includes payments in lieu of taxes that are not payments for, and are not reasonably equivalent in value to, services provided. In governmental funds, transfers should be reported as other financing uses in the funds making transfers and as other financing sources in the funds receiving transfers. In proprietary funds, transfers should be reported after nonoperating revenues and expenses. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for encumbrances.
Restricted for district emergency reserve (letter of credit or real estate).
Information about changes in OPEB fiduciary net position.
Information about tax liens receivable.
Information about expenditures for cultural activities.
Information about expenditures for school district, other uses.

Amounts paid for personal services to both permanent and temporary school district employees, including personnel substituting for those in permanent positions. This includes gross salary for personal services rendered while on the payroll of the school district. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for elementary, middle or high school for instruction in Co‐curricular Activities, Nonathletic.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for noncurrent loans receivable.
Other financing sources, lease financing. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about OPEB.
Tax liens receivable. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Fund balance committed to capital projects reserve.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for advance to other funds.
Information about rent receivable.
Allowance for refunds, modified accrual.
Information about changes in net OPEB liability (asset).

Amounts paid by the school district for employee assistance program benefits which are not classified above Often these are included as gross income on W-2's (eg, auto allowance). Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from investment income and rentals, reported on a modified accrual basis.
An advance of loan proceeds provided to the developers to pay for eligible costs to be repaid in future reporting periods .
Information about expenditures for school district, facilities acquisition and construction services.

Expenditures for moneys Set‐Aside for specific purposes and identifies those portions of the fund balance (the excess of revenues over expenditures) which are segregated for future purposes and/or are not available to finance expenditures of the subsequent accounting period. Some reserves are statutorily mandated while others are in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles or practices. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for capital assets held for resale.
Amounts due related to operating leases and rental agreements. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue from dwelling rents including credit amount for which the participant is entitled to a utility allowance payment. If the rent calculation, after deducting the utility allowance, results in a utility reimbursement due to the tenant, the amounts of such utility reimbursement is included as a debit to this account.
OPEB plan employer contributions.
Information about transfers and other activities.
Amounts paid for goods and services not otherwise classified. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Interfund Loans Receivable.

A consumption of OPEB related net assets deferred due to differences between expected and actuarial experience with regard to economic or demographic factors. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students.
Deposits and short-term, highly liquid investments with an outside trustee. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts for medical billings receivable., net of allowance for uncollectible accounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for school district, non instructional services.
Current amount due to the local unit on Interfund loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving new sites. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Cash and investments. Cash includes not only currency on hand, but also demand deposits with banks or other financial institutions. Cash also includes deposits in other kinds of accounts or cash management pools that have the general characteristics of demand deposit accounts in that the governmental enterprise may deposit additional cash at any time and also effectively may withdraw cash at any time without prior notice or penalty. Investments amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for Recreation and Culture, Library services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from intermediate sources, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portions of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that are attributed to valuation years.
Amounts for ambulance services receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local government unit for services performed but not yet billed, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students.
OPEB Plan contributions from nonemployer contributing entities.
Flows of assets (such as cash or goods) without equivalent flows of assets in return and without a requirement for repayment.
Represents medical liabilities incurred but not reported.
Deposits provided by customer that will be payable from restricted assets.
Information about expenditures for all other government activities.

Expenditures for other general government services and the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts for fire protection services accounts receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about extraordinary and special items.

Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Used to record net (expense) revenue for the charter school funding.
Investments held by third parties recorded on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for school district, support service programs.

Expenditures for activities concerned with providing food to students and staff in a school or school district. This service area includes preparing and serving regular and incidental meals, lunches or snacks in connection with school activities and food delivery Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for delinquent taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts for emergency medical services receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Used to record net (expense) revenue for funding for component units.

Used on the General Fund of all local units of government. Its use is mandatory. It reflects such expenditures as building maintenance, grounds maintenance, janitor service, fuel, utilities, etc., for a county courthouse, city, village, or township hall, or other municipal office building. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for fire stations and buildings other than the general municupal buildings, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net change in Net OPEB Liability.
Matured bonds payable, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for All other support services not classified elsewhere in the 2000 series. Severance payments to support staff must be coded here. Severance pay to teachers must be coded to 0090 – Other General Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for financial and tax administration.
Restricted for endowments.
Inventory of goods held for resale. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for conservation services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for conservation services.
Transactions or other events that are both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence.
Net Investment Income earned by the OPEB plan.

Expenditures for activities designed to assess and improve the well‐being of students and to supplement the teaching process. These services pertain to interaction between students and teachers by designing the educational program for the needs of individual students. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Gifted and Talented Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
OPEB plan member contributions.

Expenditures for parks for example, supervision, park areas, parkways and boulevards, forestry and nursery, policing and lighting. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for assessing equalization.
Expenditures for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Elementary Education. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from customers not yet collected, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Deposits and short-term, highly liquid investments with Treasurer. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other Property. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for health department boards and clinics.

Other accounts receivables reported not elsewhere classified. Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A consumption of OPEB related net assets arising from difference between projected and actual OPEB plan investment earnings. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Cash received from property tax payments.
Cash receipts from other government units to cover a portion of the cost of treating the medically indigent.
Other taxes receivable which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Interest receivable on investments.
State grants for drunk driving case flow assistance. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenses for streets and highways.
Amount due from a local unit as its share of the cost of an improvement financed by special assessments. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Disclosures for capital assets, reported net of accumulated depreciation or amortization.

Amount of all notes of a long-term nature (over one year) owed by the local unit. Debit upon payment of such notes; credit for the face amounts of long-term notes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Fees earned through administering the collection of taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other cash flows from non capital financing activities, not elsewhere classified.

Amounts owed by a local unit of government to another local unit. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures incurred for various public health and mental health programs within a local unit, as well as programs providing assistance for economically disadvantaged persons and businesses within the area. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to townships. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Cash received from tax levied.
Information about expenses for health and welfare.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of additions or improvements to assets held under a lease arrangement, reported net of accumulated depreciation.

Expenditures for public safety services, fire department. Used on the General Fund or Fire Fund of local units of government that have such an activity. Units with a fire department may budget separately for activities such as administration, firefighting, fire prevention, training, and communication. Reflects such expenditures such as salaries and wages, fire-fighting supplies, firefighting equipment, office supplies, vehicle and equipment maintenance, and other supplies, and equipment necessary for fire protection. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts set aside specifically to repair, replace and improve capital projects in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).

Noncapital financing activities include borrowing money for purposes other than to acquire, construct, or improve capital assets and repaying those amounts borrowed, including interest. This category includes proceeds from all borrowings (such as revenue anticipation notes) not clearly attributable to acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets, regardless of the form of the borrowing. Also included are certain other interfund and intergovernmental receipts and payments.

Expenses associated with public health and sanitation services. It includes all public health activities; except provision of hospital care. Includes: environmental health activities, health regulation and inspection, water and air pollution control, mosquito control, animal control warden, inspection of food handling establishments, ambulance and paramedic services. not part of a fire department, public health nursing, vital statistics collection, all other services. performed directly by the public health department but excludes payments under public welfare programs.

Represents the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit, due within one year. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash received from quality assurance supplement program.
Amounts due to villages. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from libraries.
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for long term advances to other funds.

Facility held for productive use including, but not limited to, office, production, storage and distribution facilities and any addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, for example, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Information about expenses for gas, water and electric.
Information about all other state aid grants.

Short-term amounts due from tax collection funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
Revenue from county expense of sale. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing, net of accumulated depreciation.
Expenses associated with electricity and power services.
Expenditures for general government, finance and tax administration. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Inventory which is materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from treasurer, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash payments to managed care outside provider claims.

Reflects the portion of fund balance that is legally restricted as to the purposes for which it may be used. Often a fund’s entire fund balance will be restricted, but sometimes, such as in the General Fund, only a portion will be restricted.

The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in road work such as motor graders, cranes, rollers, etc, reported net of accumulated depreciation.

Cost of assets that are being held for re-sale. Assets acquired with the intent of reselling should be reported as assets even if capital in nature. However, the carrying value should not exceed the estimated sales proceeds, net of expenditures necessary to ready the asset for sale. An example of assets held for sale could houses purchased to be renovated and resold. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
State grants for indigent defense, such as assigned counsel, Public defender, and Contractual arrangements. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash received from interest earnings and rental income.
Revenue earned from ordinance fines and costs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenses for community and economic development.
Prepaid insurance.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of machinery and equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in a repair and maintenance shop, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Revenue earned from services rendered, not elsewhere classified. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Used in the General Fund of all local units of government. Its use is mandatory. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., necessary for the office operation. This Activity Number may also be used to separate revenue earned by the treasurer’s office from other General Fund revenue. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with community services.
Cash payments to contractors for goods and services purchased.
Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts collected for and owed to the State by a local unit of government. Debit for all payments to the State; credit for all amounts owed to the State. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Used in the General Fund of all local units of government. Its use is mandatory. Units may reflect all election expenditures within this single activity. Examples of expenditures incurred are printing of ballots, board of canvasser expenditures, postage, travel, election workers, recount expenditures, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash received from permit, fees and special assessments levied.
Information about expenses for recreation and culture.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in the engineering department, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Revenue earned from ambulance transport fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts due in more than one year from component units. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
Cash received from special assessment levied.
Expenses for Recreation and Culture, Library services.
Property tax revenue, including delinquent taxes, penalties, interest, fees, and community wide special assessments. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from fees charged for services not elsewhere classified. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Investments in associates, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.

The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used for yard or storage purposes such as gasoline pumps and meters, fuel storage tanks, etc., reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Other operating receipts.
Information about expenses for public works.
Property tax administration fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The portion of personal property taxes levied which have become due but have not become delinquent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other operating payments.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of office equipment and furniture of a more or less permanent nature, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Amounts collected for and owed to the Federal Government by a local unit of government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Water rights are the right to legally appropriate water and put it to beneficial use now and in the future.
Amount of taxes levied and related charges which have become due but have not been collected, and which are net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements.

Special assessment taxes due to the government entity, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received, due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses incurred in the Enterprise Fund Category of any unit that is administering and/or operating water and/or sewer systems and/or projects. This Activity Number is used to account for all revenue and expenses involved in this operation.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of office equipment and furniture.
Information about other receivables.
Amount of land contracts due to the local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other cash flows from operating activities, not elsewhere classified.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of tangible personal property used to produce goods and services, including, but not limited to, tools, dies and molds, computer and office equipment, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Accrued expenses payable.
Information about Expenses for recreation and culture.
Revenues from interest and dividends, reported on a modified accrual basis..

Used on the General Fund of certain counties, cities, villages, and townships. Included are the costs of the attorney or attorneys who render legal advice to the governing body or administrative agencies of the government. Activities may include drafting laws, ordinances, or administrative regulations for the local government and its constituent agencies and serving as counsel in lawsuits to which the government is a party. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of equipment commonly used in offices and stores that have no permanent connection to the structure of a building or utilities. Examples includes machinery, furniture, fixtures, vehicles, computers, electronic devices, and office machines, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Expenditures incurred by committees of the governing body.
Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to other government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Program expenses for housing and community development services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Represents collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture.
Advances to other units of government where such advances are not due within a year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash flows from operating activities, not elsewhere classified. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Amounts due to libraries.

Amounts withheld from employees (other than social security and income taxes) for payments to other agencies. Examples are health and life insurance premiums, credit union deductions, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue associated with community service.
Information about net (expense) revenue for programs and functions on the Statement of Activities.

Amounts due to employees of the local unit. Examples are underpayment of salaries, excessive payroll withholding, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of all vehicles and equipment that are required to have a license plate such as cars, trucks, etc. reported net of accumulated depreciation.

A sum of money either in the form of currency, a special bank deposit, or a separate bank account set aside for the purpose of making change or paying incidental expenses. It is used for expenses that, for practical reasons, cannot be paid in the regular manner. At certain intervals, the petty cash is replenished by a check drawn on the fund from which the petty cash expenses are payable. An itemized voucher for the amount of disbursements made from petty cash must support the replenishment check. The total of petty cash on hand and/or on deposit, plus un-replenished disbursements, must always equal the imprest cash account balance. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

This account is used to record amounts of pension assets on deposit with a fiscal agent, OPEB funding, and deposits with bond trustees prior to payment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about net (expense) revenue by program activity.
Unamortized premium on bonds, principal due within one year.

Used in the General Fund of local units of government. Its use is mandatory for units having this department or director. It reflects salaries, travel, office supplies, equipment, etc., necessary to operate this department. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of fire apparatus, ambulances and other vehicles.
Information about net (expense) revenue for general government.
Expenses for the General Fund for units having such an officer.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of other fire support equipment.
Expenditures for general government services. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in patient receivable.
Net (expense) revenue associated with general government services, legislative and executive.
Amount of payments related to contracts that are due and payable within the normal operating cycle.

Expenditures for street cleaning, used on the General Fund, Major Street Fund, Local Street Fund, or Municipal Street Fund of cities and villages. It reflects such expenditures as salaries and wages, materials, supplies, and other expenditures applicable to the street cleaning activity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Used in the General Fund of counties. It is used to record expenditures related to duties performed in accordance with requirements of 1990 PA 345, State Survey and Remonumentation Act, MCL 54.261 to MCL 54.279. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, professional consultants, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of books, publications, journals, and similar items if significant in value and with a useful life of more than one year, reported net of accumulated depreciation.

Amounts including severance pay, vacation pay, and other benefits due but not paid when employment was terminated. This account may also be used in a local unit retirement fund to record amounts due to members of the retirement system who have resigned or left the system prior to retirement. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about net (expense) revenue for public safety.
Increase (decrease) in property tax receivable.
Amounts due from road commissions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of natural resources which diminish in value by the removal of contents such as gravel pits, stone quarries, timber stands, brine wells, gas and oil wells, etc., reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Amounts owed by a local unit to the federal government where such amounts are due in years subsequent to the current fiscal year.

Net (expense) revenue associated with security of persons and property services. Includes a) police agencies for preventing, controlling, or reducing crime; law enforcement activities of sheriff and constable offices; coroners; medical examiners; vehicular inspection activities; traffic control and safety activities; lock-up operations and excludes contributions to a local police pension fund, local court activities, and local correction activities, b) firefighting and fire prevention and ambulance and paramedic services handled by the fire department, contributions of volunteer fire units, but excludes contributions to a local fire pension fund, forest fire protection amounts.

Expenditures for public safety administration, used on the General Fund or Police (Sheriff) Fund of local units of governments. Reflects such expenditures as salaries of the department head and administrative staff, office supplies, travel, equipment, and other expenditures of an administrative nature.
Tax, utility and assessment receivables. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost or acquisition value of streets and highways, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Amounts collected for and owed to the State by a local unit of government that are due in more than one year. Debit for all payments to the State; credit for all amounts owed to the State.
Information about net (expense) revenue for streets and highways.
Increase (decrease) in supplies.
Net (expense) revenue associated with highways and streets.
Increase (decrease) in amounts due from component unit.
Amount of taxes or other amounts collected for or owed to an intermediate school district. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost or acquisition value of mains and conections, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets.
Used as an identifier for Business type activities or Governmental Activities for Internal Service Funds, used with proprietary funds statements.
Due from employees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about net (expense) revenue for health and hospitals and welfare.
Increase (decrease) in estimated amounts due from third party payers.
An acquisition of net assets related to lease transactions that applies to a future reporting period(s).
Used as an identifier for Business type activities or Governmental Activities for Internal Service Funds, used with proprietary funds statements.

Special assessment taxes due to the government entity, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (expense) revenue associated with public health and sanitation services. It includes all public health activities; except provision of hospital care. Includes: environmental health activities, health regulation and inspection, water and air pollution control, mosquito control, animal control warden, inspection of food handling establishments, ambulance and paramedic services. not part of a fire department, public health nursing, vital statistics collection, all other services. performed directly by the public health department but excludes payments under public welfare programs.

Expenditures for drain commissioner and water resource commissioner. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, and other administrative expenditures necessary to operate this office. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Accrued interest on investments purchased.
Amount of taxes or other amounts collected for or owed to a community college. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The cost or acquisition value of parks and recreation equipment, reported net of accumulated depreciation.
Increase (decrease) in other receivables.

Expenditures for public safety services, parole. Used on the General Fund of local units of government having such a facility. It reflects such expenditures as salaries of parole officers and other parole department personnel, travel expenditures, supplies, and equipment necessary for the operation of such an office or department. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents business-type activities on the proprietary funds financial statements, which is one of two classes of activities reported in government-wide financial statements. Business-type activities are financed in whole or in part by fees charged to external parties for goods or services. These activities usually are reported in enterprise funds.
Amount of liabilities for unused vacation. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about net (expense) revenue for water and electric utilities.

Program net (expense) revenue used for electricity and power services, which are incremental net (expense) revenue derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The public utility providing facilities for the jurisdictional transmission and distribution of electricity to retail customers, except building or facility owners/operators that manage the internal distribution system serving such building or facility and that supply electric power and other related electric power services to occupants of the building or facility.
The cost or acquisition value of the utility, reported net of accumulated depreciation.

Proceeds received from bond issues to finance primary and local road construction and improvements in special assessment districts, and advances or prepayments received from individuals and local units in these districts to finance this work. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Increase (decrease) in accrued expenses.
Information about net (expense) revenue for housing and community development.
Expenses for recruitment fees.
Information about net (expense) revenue for culture and recreation.
Information about patient accounts receivable.
Information about assets.
Increase (decrease) in amounts due to third party payers.
Amount of non-capital contributions.

Amount of the local government unit's liability for payroll taxes incurred but not due until a later date. Debit upon payment or reversing the entry; credit monthly or at the end of the fiscal year for amounts of accrued taxes.
Program revenues used for education, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Net position at beginning of period (after adjustments). Amounts reflected as the opening balance of net position after adjustments.
Net (expense) revenue associated with information technology.
Revenue generated from the operation of the food service program. This is local revenue.
Program revenues used for golf, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Federal aid, grants, contributions and donations from federal government for community and economic development block grants (CDBG), reported on the General Fund or a special Federal Project Fund. It is used to account for participation in the federal CDBG program. It includes such expenditures as salaries and wages of local unit personnel involved, advertising expenditures, appropriations or contractual payments to local agencies assisting in such programs, supplies, materials, and other expenditures essential to programs aimed at benefitting economically disadvantaged individuals. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net OPEB liability (i.e., Fiduciary Net Position) calculated using a healthcare cost trend rate that is 1-percentage-point higher than the assumed healthcare cost trend rate.
Expenses for activities concerned with building additions and with installing or extending service systems and other built‐in equipment.
Premium on issuance of long term debt. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Program revenues used for community development, which are incremental revenues derived from the specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. Community development is the practice of taking on activities that provide basic services to communities. It supports the development of strong communities to improve quality of life.
Revenue earned from an intermediate governmental unit in lieu of land.

Expenditures for the initial and replacement items of equipment, such as machinery, furniture, fixtures, and vehicles. Machinery, furniture, and fixtures (including teacher desks, chairs, and file cabinets), technology equipment, and other equipment that are used for instructional purposes should be charged to appropriate instructional programs. The district’s capital asset policy establishes criteria for when an equipment item must be capitalized and included on the district’s property inventory records. Usually this criteria requires equipment costing above a certain dollar amount to be capitalized. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts withheld from employees (other than social security and income taxes) for payments to other agencies. Examples are health and life insurance premiums, credit union deductions, etc.
Fees earned from other sources such as welfare agencies and private sources for transporting students to and from school and school activities.
Limited Tax Bonds.
Deferred revenue.
Amount of unrestricted general fund carryover cash balance at year end.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Post‐Secondary Education for K‐12 Students.
Amounts due from customers not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from use and admission fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of all notes of a long-term nature (current and noncurrent portions) owed by the local unit. Debit upon payment of such notes; credit for the face amounts of long-term notes.
Expenditures for community promotion. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A liability arising from payments not made to pension funds. This amount represents any difference between the actuarially determined annual required contribution and actual payments made to the pension fund. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Restricted for state preschool program reserve.
Revenue from industrial facilities tax.
Information about accrued interest receivable.
Fund Balance, restricted for fire impact expenditures.
Any special assessment that is assessed on a community-wide basis, such an Act 33 public safety millage, should be reported as a tax.

A consumption of pension related net assets deferred due to changes in assumptions about future economic and demographic factors such as inflation, health care costs trend rates, salary changes, ad hoc post‐employment benefit changes, and mortality rates. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Information about long term debt.
The date of experience studies on which the significant assumptions used in the actuarial valuation are based.
Indicates the audit status of reported statements, which can be reported as audited, unaudited, reviewed, or unreviewed.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities.
State capital grants. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue for activities concerned with keeping the physical plant open, comfortable and safe for use and keeping the grounds, buildings and equipment in effective working condition and state of repair. These include the activities of maintaining safety in buildings, on the grounds and in the vicinity of schools. Minor remodeling which does not change the capital assets of the building should be charged here. Major remodeling should be charged to 4000, Facilities Acquisition and Construction Services.
Amounts due and payable for educational purposes within the normal operating cycle.
Expenditures to refunded bond escrow agent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from property tax levied using the current taxable value of the property and the agency's certified tax rate. Property taxes are ad-valorem taxes levied on an assessed valuation of real property.
Information about tuition and fees receivable.
Expenses associated with Debt service, principal repayment.
Expenditure associated with highways and streets. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about expenditures for all other public works.

Amount of wages earned by employees that are due and payable. Debit upon payment or by reversing the entry; credit for amounts of salaries and wages earned but not paid as of the end of an accounting period.
Aggregate amount of long term debt, excluding compensated absences, both current and noncurrent.
A description of the OPEB Plan Mortality Rate Table used in the actuarial valuation.

Amount of wages earned by employees and related liabilities that are due and payable. Debit upon payment or by reversing the entry; credit for amounts of salaries and wages earned but not paid as of the end of an accounting period.
Net (expense) revenue associated with facilities maintenance.
Program revenues used for transportation services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Amount of derivative instruments liability, classified as noncurrent.
Indicates the audit opinion expressed by the auditor which can be reported as qualified, adverse, unmodified or disclaimed.
Unlimited tax bonds, amount due in more than one year.
Amount of interest paid on sewer system debt.

Carrying amounts of tuition and other associated fees, for example, registration as of the balance sheet date. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue generated from Fees.
Name of restricted net position which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Revenue for activities concerned with building additions and with installing or extending service systems and other built‐in equipment.
Revenue earned from fees charged for services not elsewhere classified.
OPEB Plan contribution deficiency (excess).
Information about utility bills receivable.
Restricted for capital assets held for resale.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of obligations due all related parties.
Date on which audit opinion was expressed by the auditor.

An acquisition of pension related net assets deferred due to changes in assumptions about future economic and demographic factors such as inflation, health care costs trend rates, salary changes, ad hoc post‐employment benefit changes, and mortality rates. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
Revenue from commercial facilities tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from cable TV franchise fees.
Revenue earned from attorney fee reimbursement charges. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other capital assets, classified as depreciable, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
Program revenues used for higher education, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Net OPEB Liability as a percentage of covered payroll.
Revenue earned from fines.
Revenues from community organizations or agencies for other community service activities.
Revenue from trailer tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for General Post‐Secondary Education for K‐12 Students.
Amounts reported for deferred inflows that are tied to grants. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of the state to which the reporting entity belongs.
The liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit pension plan.
Revenue from current property taxes, extra or special voted. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
In a special funding situation, the nonemployer contributing entities' total proportionate share of the collective net OPEB liability.

Amount of accrued bond interest due in the current fiscal year. Debit upon payment of such interest when due; credit at the end of the fiscal year for the amount of interest expense accrued during the fiscal year but not paid as of the end of the year.
Expenses associated with debt service, interest and fiscal charges. Interest and fiscal charges covers debt service payments other than principal repayment.
Revenue from parking occupancy tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue earned from ordinance fines and costs.
Restricted for full day kindergarten reserve.
Additions to general obligation bonds.
Information about Taxes Receivable and other tax related items.
The date management submits their Transmittal Letter accompanying the Management Discussion & Analysis.

A financial instrument or other contract that has all of the following characteristics: a. Settlement factors. It has (1) one or more reference rates and (2) one or more notional amounts or payment provisions or both. b. Leverage. It requires no initial net investment or an initial net investment that is smaller than would be required for other types of contracts that would be expected to have a similar response to changes in market factors. c. Net settlement. Its terms require or permit net settlement, it can readily be settled net by a means outside the contract, or it provides for delivery of an asset that puts the recipient in a position not substantially different from net settlement.

An Intergrant Transfer is when revenue is transferred from one grant to another, and those moneys are spent accordingly. Example: transfer Title II Part A "Teacher Quality" grant revenue (grant 4367) over to Title I (grant 4010), and spend the transferred Teacher Quality money as Title I money.
