Net (expense) revenue associated with township properties.

A consumption of pension related net assets due to contributions to the pension plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Revenue internal to the district from other funds or programs for services provided.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with keeping the physical plant open, comfortable and safe for use and keeping the grounds, buildings and equipment in effective working condition and state of repair. These include the activities of maintaining safety in buildings, on the grounds and in the vicinity of schools. Minor remodeling which does not change the capital assets of the building should be charged here.
Revenue from accommodations tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other current assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Expenditure for engineers and engineering, used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries of the engineer and assistants, travel expenditures, engineer supplies, engineer equipment, and other supplies, or equipment essential to operation of the engineering office or department. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
In a special funding situation, the employer's proportionate share of the collective net OPEB liability.
Revenue earned from investment income and rentals.
Information about Property Taxes Receivable.
Additions to revenue bonds.
Document title.
The interest payments related to the debts and loans that are due and payable within the normal operating cycle.
Amount of interest incurred as of the balance sheet date and the penalty payments that are owed by the local government unit.
Amounts due to others that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Revenue earned from fines. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for other general government services and the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Total annual final appropriations for all funds for the reporting period.
The net asset or liability of employers and nonemployer contributing entities to employees for benefits provided through a defined benefit OPEB plan. This is also known as Fiduciary Net Position.
Financial inflows from other funds of the government reporting entity not classified as interfund services provided, reimbursements or loans.

Used on the General Fund and Retirement Fund of local units of government. For units with retirement systems and VEBA (Voluntary Employee Beneficiaries Association). It reflects administrative expenses of a retirement system and benefits paid to retirees. Also reflects contributions by employees and employers, interest earned on investments and other retirement system revenues. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
The payroll amount on which contributions to an OPEB plan are based.
Revenue from federal sources that the State Department of Education sends to districts and Board of Cooperative Educational Services.
Additions to notes payable.
Program revenues used for unemployment compensation, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with building additions and with installing or extending service systems and other built‐in equipment.

Portion of the real property taxes levied which have become due but have not been returned to the county treasurer as delinquent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount due on construction contracts which have been completed but on which part of the liability has not been paid pending final inspection or the lapse of a specified time period, or both. The unpaid amount is usually a stated percentage of the contract price.
Revenue from industrial facilities tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenues earned after the property tax foreclosure process within the delinquent tax revolving fund. The act states the foreclosing governmental unit must deposit the proceeds from the sale of tax delinquent property into a "restricted account" created for each year a property sale is held. The restricted accounts should be established within the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund based on the year of the sale. This activity (Activity # 254--Delinquent Tax Property Sales) is used to record the sale proceeds and the authorized expenditures of the proceeds. When the forfeited property is sold, the proceeds from the sale should be recorded in the Delinquent Property Tax Revolving Fund under revenue account "Charge for Services-Sales." Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from probate court, used on the General Fund of a county. Reflects statutory revenue for estate cases, adoptions, and other probate matters. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Personal Property Taxes Receivable.
Intergovernmental agreement payable, principal due within one year.

Inside millage which is a tax rate on property, expressed in mills of the property's value. Millage is used to calculate property taxes. Inside millage is levied by the state without the need for a vote.
Additions to revenue anticipation note, includes all refunding issues.
Restricted for risk related, restricted capital reserve.
Expenses associated with debt service, interest and fiscal charges, as well as principal repayment.
Revenues earned from the transportation system used on the General Fund or Transportation System Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Programs for Adults, Continuing.

Expenditures for surveyor, used on the General Fund. It reflects such expenditures as salaries, travel, supplies, equipment, etc., necessary to operate the office of the county surveyor. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Revenue from commercial facilities tax.
Name of other current liabilities which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

The net OPEB liability is measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments that is attributed to past periods of employee service, net of the OPEB plan's fiduciary net position.
Revenue from income tax which are taxes derived from state, municipal or school district income tax. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about income taxes.
Outside millage, which is a tax rate on property, expressed in mills of the property's value and is used to calculate property taxes. Outside millage is voted on by residents.
Accrued interest on investments purchased, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Additions to short term debt, including refunding issues.
Restricted net position for capital projects.

Expenses associated with general government, classified as judicial. Includes all county or municipal court and court-related activities including juries, probate officials, prosecutors, bailiffs, marshals, public defenders, attorneys, legal departments, and court activities of sheriffs departments and excludes all activities related to probation and parole.

Compensated absences payable, classified as current. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer.
Revenue from redemptions and reconveyances.
Property tax rate. Property taxes are ad-valorem taxes levied on an assessed valuation of real property.
Net (expense) revenue associated with education services.
Limited tax bonds, amount due in more than one year.
Income tax receivable which are taxes derived from state income tax not yet received. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenues earned from health and welfare, child care, family division of circuit court, used n the General Fund or the Child Care Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenses for activities concerned with the transportation of students to and from their places of residence and the public schools in which enrolled, including any site attended for special education, career or technical education and to and from one school of attendance and another in vehicles owned or rented and operated by the school district or under contract with the school district. This would include all school activities.
Additions to tax anticipation note, include all refunding issues.
Revenue from federal sources that the State Department of Education sends to districts and Board of Cooperative Educational System.
Amount of liabilities for unused vacation.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the use of infrastructure.

An acquisition of net assets applicable to changes in the employer’s proportion of the collective net pension liability since the prior measurement date, the net effect of that change on the employer's proportionate shares of the collective net pension liability and collective deferred outflows of resources and deferred inflows of resources related to pension, determined as of the beginning of the measurement period.
Information about sales tax receivable.

Used in the General Fund of a city, village, or township. Its use is mandatory. It reflects salaries, travel, supplies, and other expenditures of the statutory board of review. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Property tax valuation. Property taxes are ad-valorem taxes levied on an assessed valuation of real property.
Program revenues used for garage services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Revenue earned from forfeitures.
Internal balances payable, which are the net residual amounts due between governmental and business-type activities.

Expenses for court of equity which is a type of court that hears cases involving remedies other than monetary damages, such as injunctions, writs, or specific performance and a court of law, only hears cases involving monetary damages.
Additions to all other purpose long term debt.

Cost of assets that are being held for re-sale. Assets acquired with the intent of reselling should be reported as assets even if capital in nature. However, the carrying value should not exceed the estimated sales proceeds, net of expenditures necessary to ready the asset for sale. An example of assets held for sale could houses purchased to be renovated and resold.
Amounts due to government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity.

A consumption of pension related net assets deferred due to differences between expected and actuarial experience with regard to economic or demographic factors. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Expenses for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving land.
Amount of tax levied upon the sale or consumption of goods that are not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other deferred inflows of resources which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Expenses associated with depreciation, unallocated.
Information about expenditures for recreation and culture.
Restricted for BEST Capital reserve.
Additions to all other debt instruments with an original term of more than one year. Does not include general obligation bonds, revenue bonds, notes payable, unlimited tax bonds or limited tax bonds.
Expenses associated with medical care facilities.
Expenses associated with public utilities.
Revenue earned from statute costs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about delinquent taxes receivable.
Net (expense) revenue associated with higher education.
Financial outflows to other funds of the government reporting entity not classified as interfund services provided, reimbursements or loans.

Unclaimed money in the possession of the local unit such as outstanding or unclaimed payroll checks and other checks, unclaimed meter deposits, other unclaimed trust, and agency money, etc. Unclaimed money must be reported to the State Treasurer annually. Unclaimed money is considered to be abandoned: 1) attempts to contact the owner fail. If these attempts are unsuccessful, the money is turned over to the State Treasurer where the owner or the owner's heirs may claim it, 2) The due date for the annual unclaimed property report (holder report) is July 1 for property reaching its dormancy period as of March 31.
Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Programs for Adults, Continuing.
Revenue earned from tuition and fees assessed against students for educational and general purposes.
Additions to limited tax bonds.
Amounts collected for and owed to the State by a local unit of government. Debit for all payments to the State; credit for all amounts owed to the State.
Past due taxes revenues that are not expected to be collected within the normal operating cycle. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for parks policing used on the General Fund or a Parks/Recreation Fund. It reflects such expenses as salaries and wages, supplies, uniforms, materials, and equipment necessary to police park operations or recreation programs of a local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of special assessment debt with government commitment due in more than one year.
Name of other expenditure disclosed. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Program revenues used for jail stores commissary services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Revenue earned from taxes derived from state, municipal or school district income tax.
Amounts due to other funds within the same reporting entity.

Revenue earned from the transfer of abandoned or unclaimed assets, property, accounts or money to the government, often because the person died without heirs or without naming beneficiaries. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
State grants for drug case information management. Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.
Additions to unlimited tax bonds.
Information about other taxes receivable.
Restricted for total program reserve.

Other noncurrent liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services.

Revenue for activities concerned with the transportation of students to and from their places of residence and the public schools in which enrolled, including any site attended for special education, career or technical education and to and from one school of attendance and another in vehicles owned or rented and operated by the school district or under contract with the school district. This would include all school activities.
Restricted net position for general government.
State grants for all public safety purposes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other deferred outflows of resources which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Other fees earned for transporting individuals to and from activities not classifiable elsewhere.
Expenses associated with cost of issue of bonds and securities.
Additions to long term debt excluding compensated absences, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Revenue from county expense of sale.
Money deposited with the local unit by contractors, other firms, or individuals to guarantee the performance of a certain act or acts.

Other taxes receivable which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
State grants for local community stabilization share. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the use of streets and highways.
Net (expense) revenue associated with unemployment compensation.
Amounts collected for and owed to the fiduciary funds within the same reporting entity. Debit for all payments to the fiduciary fund; credit for all amounts owed to the fiduciary fund.
Expenditures for mosquito control, used on the General Fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from shared revenue which is a government unit’s apportioning of part of its tax income to other units of government. For example, provinces or states may share revenue with local governments, or national governments may share revenue with provinces or states.
Face amount of proceeds from issuance of bonds.
Asset retirement obligations, principal due within one year.
Expenses associated with community development.
Revenue for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving land.
Information about taxes receivable.
Premium amount of proceeds from issuance of bonds.
Used to group information about items on the Long Term Debt footnote.
Description of other financing sources (uses). Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Amount of interest paid on electric power system debt.
Earnings on investments in real property.
State grants for health and/or hospitals purposes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenditures for salaries and employee benefits, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Expenses associated with golf.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the use of parks and recreation equipment.
Program revenues used for contingency services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Other noncurrent liabilities, which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Information about interest and penalties receivable.
Information about unamortized premium on bonds.
Advances received from others.
Revenue earned from building inspection fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from general obligation bonds.
Expenses associated with water supply services.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the use of utilities.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Programs for Adults, Continuing.

Excess of proceeds received from the sale of bonds over and above the par value, due in more than one year, which remains to be amortized over the remaining life of such bonds (this amount does not include accrued interest to the date of sale).
Name of other noncurrent assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.

Other expenses which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Must be used with a typed dimension to indicate a fact which is custom created for that reporting entity.
Revenue earned from sale of advertising.
Proceeds from refunding bonds, mortgages, notes, and other short or long-term borrowing clearly attributable to the acquisition, construction, or improvement of capital assets.
Advances from other funds that are within the same reporting entity.
Contributions from local government units for welfare. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Penalties Receivable.
Information about bond premiums.

Compensated absences payable, classified as noncurrent. Compensated absences are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from revenue bonds.
Expenses associated with conservation services.
Amounts due and payable to the escrow agent.
Accumulated depreciation of meters.
Net (expense) revenue associated with garage services.

An acquisition of OPEB related net assets due to contributions to the OPEB plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an inflow of resources (revenue) until then.
Revenue earned from title search fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Transfer to escrow for bond refunding.
Noncurrent liabilities, due within one year, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
Information about installment debt.
Revenue earned from transaction privilege tax levy.
Includes amounts paid to contractors for minor renovating and remodeling facilities. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with the transportation of students to and from their places of residence and the public schools in which enrolled, including any site attended for special education, career or technical education and to and from one school of attendance and another in vehicles owned or rented and operated by the school district or under contract with the school district. This would include all school activities.

Services which by their nature can be performed only by persons or firms with specialized skills and knowledge. While a product may or may not result from the transaction, the primary reason for the purchase is the service provided Included are the services of architects, engineers, auditors, dentists, medical doctors, lawyers, consultants, teachers, accountants, brokers, etc. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Program revenues used for other services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.

Expenditures for law library, used on the General Fund and Law Library Fund of a county. Its use is mandatory. It is charged with the purchase of law books and other publications for the law library. (The circuit judge approves purchases). Used for amounts reported on a modified accrual basis.

Revenue earned from interest on loans generated through the Bankhead–Jones Farm Tenant Act of 1937 (P.L. 75-210) which was passed on July 22, 1937 and authorized acquisition by the federal government of damaged lands to rehabilitate and use for various purposes. The law authorized a credit program to assist tenant farmers to purchase land.
Name of other revenue disclosed. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Amounts owed and payable for insurance claims, due in more than one year.
Reductions from notes payable.

Used to classify the acquisition of capital assets through a capital financing (lease) agreement instead of using a conventional loan process. This code will be used only for Leases under GASB Statement No. 87 after implementation.

Net (expense) revenue for court of equity which is a type of court that hears cases involving remedies other than monetary damages, such as injunctions, writs, or specific performance and a court of law, only hears cases involving monetary damages.

Program revenues used for other public services, which are incremental revenues derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base. The technical definition of public service is a service provided by the government to the people in a specific jurisdiction. Services may be provided by the government itself, or paid to a private organization to provide them. For instance, a fire or police department is a government-run agency, but trash pickup provided by an independent contractor is a public service financed by the jurisdiction.
Amount of claims that the entity is responsible for paying within the normal reporting cycle.
Information about Grants and Contracts Accounts Receivable that are due within one year.
Other capital assets not elsewhere reported including both capital assets being depreciated, and capital assets not being depreciated.
Payments made for refunded bonds and notes.
Information on the long term debt footnote.
Revenue earned from court filing fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Deposits received related to bond transactions.

A consumption of pension related net assets arising from difference between projected and actual pension plan investment earnings. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
Reductions from revenue anticipation note, includes all refunded debt).
An advance of loan proceeds provided to the developers to pay for eligible costs.
Net (expense) revenue associated with medical care facility.
Net (Expense) Revenue for activities concerned with initially acquiring and improving land.
Information about land contract receivables that are due within one year.
Other expenses which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Obligations payable from restricted assets whose liquidation is reasonably expected to require the use of existing resources properly classifiable as current assets, or the creation of other current liabilities.
Used to collect information about the Long Term Debt footnote.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due within one year under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Name of other noncurrent liabilities which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Other revenues earned from intermediate sources which are not classified elsewhere.
Amount of securities lending obligations.
Net (expense) revenue associated with jail stores commissary services.
The portion of a receivable from a contractual agreement which will not be realized within a one-year period.
Reductions from short-term debt, including all refunded debt.
Revenue from use of money and property.

Amount of accrued bond interest due in the current fiscal year which is payable from restricted assets. Debit upon payment of such interest when due; credit at the end of the fiscal year for the amount of interest expense accrued during the fiscal year but not paid as of the end of the year.
Expenditures for sanitary landfill, solid waste. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Expenditures for transportation, meals, lodging, and other expenses associated with travel for the government. Payments for per diem in lieu of reimbursements for subsistence (room and board) are also charged here. Travel costs associated with field trips are coded here except transportation costs. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

Excess of proceeds received from the sale of bonds over and above the par value, which remains to be amortized over the remaining life of such bonds (this amount does not include accrued interest to the date of sale).
Expenses for activities dealing directly with the interactions between staff and students for Integrated Education.

Net (expense) revenue associated with other public services when the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Includes support of, and assistance to, needy persons, including expenditures from State and Federal grants. Includes: money paid directly to needy persons covered by Federal aid programs (e.g., Temporary Assistance for Needy Families), money paid directly to needy persons not covered by Federal aid programs (e.g., general relief, home relief, poor relief, etc.), payments to landlords, utilities, vendors, etc., for rent, goods, and services. furnished to needy persons, other than for medical and hospital care, payments to private vendors for medical and hospital care provided to needy persons excluding payments to hospital or health agencies operated by this government, welfare institutions operated by this government, including nursing homes, veterans’ homes, homes for the elderly, and indigent care institutions, other public welfare - Administration of relief and assistance, foster care, related community action programs, and other welfare activities not reported. Excludes: any payments to the State for this government’s share of the welfare costs.

Collections of money for which the proper account is not immediately identifiable. Examples are money received from the state or federal government which is to be distributed to other funds or other units at a later date. Cash disbursements are not to be made from this account. When the proper distribution is determined, amounts must be transferred from this account to the proper account(s).

Revenue earned from the Commercial Forest program which provides a property tax incentive to private landowners to retain and manage forestland for long-term timber production and to provide foot access to the public for hunting and fishing.
Fair value of derivative instruments in a negative position at the end of the reporting period.
Profit earned from arbitrage that must be paid back (or rebated) to the federal government, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Program net (expense) revenue used for Public Utilities, which are incremental net (expense) revenue derived from that specific program, generated from sources other than the tax base.
Reductions from tax anticipation note (include all refunded debt).
State-local revenue sharing can be defined as money given to localities-primarily counties, townships, cities, and villages-to be spent on purposes determined by the localities themselves.
Negative adjustments to state categorical programs resulting from repayments to State Department of Education by categorical buyout school districts as required by Section 22-54-107, CRS.
Information about intergovernmental agreements payable.
Revenue earned from the transfer of abandoned or unclaimed assets, property, accounts or money to the government, often because the person died without heirs or without naming beneficiaries.
Information about Deposits Receivable.
Net (expense) revenue associated with community development.
Bond or insurance recoveries. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of land contracts due to the local unit within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of ticket sales for which asset recognition criteria have been met (such as cash that has been received, or amounts that are receivable), but for which it has not met the revenue recognition requirements.

Technology-related supplies include supplies that are typically used in conjunction with technology-related hardware or software. Some examples are CDs,flash or jump drives, parallel cables, and monitor stands. Software costs below the capitalization threshold should be reported here. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue associated with contingency services.
Noncurrent liabilities, which are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.

Expenses for activities, other than general administration, which support each of the other instructional and supporting services programs. These activities include planning, research, development, evaluation, information, staff, data processing and risk management services.

Expenditures for other public works services not including infrastructure, road commission, sanitation, water, electricity, airports, public transportation and other public works enterprise activities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Reductions from all other purpose long term debt.
Installment Debt, principal due within one year.
Information about Loans and Notes Receivable.
Intergovernmental Agreement Payable.
Net (expense) revenue associated with golf.
Name of restricted assets which the reporting entity separately discloses in the same statement. Used with the disaggregation line item axis.
Restricted net position for excise tax revenue.

Proceeds from other long-term debt instruments not captured in the preceding revenue source codes. Included here are Certificates of Participation and proceeds from Capital Financing (Leases). This code will not be used for Leases under GASB Statement No. 87 after implementation.

Amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered categorized as noncurrent. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities.

Reductions from all other debt instruments with an original term of more than one year. Does not include general obligation bonds, revenue bonds, notes payable, unlimited tax bonds or limited tax bonds.
Other financing sources, lease financing.
Information about pollution remediation obligations.
Other financing options, noncurrent, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Net (expense) revenue associated with water supply services.
Unemployment obligations owed by the local government unit to be paid in future reporting periods.

A consumption of net assets applicable to changes in the employer’s proportion and differences between (a) the amounts paid by the employer for pensions as the benefits came due and (b) the employer’s proportionate share of the total of certain amounts paid by the employer and nonemployer contributing entities for pensions as the benefits came due.
